Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PolarbearIV
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great service, very nice rooms. Central locatin Clean. Breakfast can be very busy and there are to few tables, and if there is a conference, be prepared to wait. Otherwise the breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: PeterdeV
Reviews.Content: A really pleasant stay all round, from good first impressions at check in to departure. Every single staff member was friendly and willing to help in any way. The only thing I would say is that the club lounge breakfast could be more varied and improved to reflect the status of the club privilege. We tried breakfast on the last day in the brasserie restaurant and while the service was again very good, the buffet selection could be better. I would have expected much better (quality and variety) meat selections for breakfast - both cold cuts and warm - at a 5 star hotel. Other than this i have no complaints about the hotel and would come and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless service & willingness to please - probably why it won Hotel of the Year 2011.”
Reviews.Author: happy1507
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family over the Easter weekend after staying on business the week before by myself. The service at breakfast was faultless, the staff were attentive and very willing to please. The rooms were all you would expect from a 5 star hotel - very clean, comfortable and stylish. This hotel is very well located and for a large hotel it still maintains an excellent personal relationship with its customers. I travel all over the world and I would certainly return to this hotel the next time I am in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ImadBz
Reviews.Content: One of the worst 5* experiences i had in my life... 1. I booked a standard room with a large size bed, and got a very unconfortable italian bed (2 single beds "artisanally" put one next to the other) 2. children were playing in the corridor till 2/3am 2 consecutive nights, and reception couldn't do anything to avoid this 3. I asked for 2 hours of late check out after all of this, and reception refused, claiming that hotel was full (a sunday afternoon?? and for just 2 hours??) 4. I asked for a Bosphorus view room, and upon arrival, reception told me that there weren't any available. once taking my room upstairs, guess what: 2 rooms with bosphorus view beign cleaned to receive people later the same day 5. Furniture and carpets in the rooms are old 6. Access to main touristic places (European side of Istanbul) is very difficult (traffic jams all the day to cross the bridge linking the two parts of the city) 7. We paid 260 Eur per night for this hotel, and for the same price, we could have taken a room in the best boutique hotel of the city in SultanAhmet

Reviews.Title: “Too old to impress”
Reviews.Author: Liteworker
Reviews.Content: 2 things were bad about my visit. The restaurant on the top floor was in renovation, and so you only had the smaller garden restaurant on the lobby floor to eat. This takes away one of the most important features of the hotel. I would have appreciated that they would have mentioned that at booking. Second the rooms...they are quite old, a bit worn out. They are roomy and comfortable, but there is much better for less money in the neighborhood. just across the street at Divan and Hyatt, When I had to extend my stay, I didn't stay at that hotel anymore. I left and took another. Just wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The upgrade helped our impression!”
Reviews.Author: ianread
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay with this chain of hotels. On the occasion we stayed at Istanbul we got upgraded to a luxury suite overlooking the water. The room was comfortable and the views from this high floor spectacular. The hotel had a nice pool area and the breakfast was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with below average service”
Reviews.Author: igazic
Reviews.Content: Coming from tourist wanna be country myself, I am realistic about expectations in emerging touristic destination. However, in 200 EUR plus per night place I expect more. First - I got horrible room, overlooking roof and some manic lights. I guess I should pay even more for sight. Staff speaks poor English. Luggage was delivered to my foom over 20 minutes since I arrived. Coffee machine at breakfirst room did not work. Prices in room are outrages.All in all, beautyful place but seriously overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view of the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Newtown_PaShopper
Reviews.Content: We selected to have the hotel car pick up us at the airport. After all that flying time I do not want to deal with a taxi. We had a written comformation from the hotel and we were provided with a detailed map as to where the driver would be. We were also instructed to look for a person holding up an i pad. We were not happy that non of this happened. We followed the instructions and found no driver, so we went back and forth looking for him. Finally a young women not professionaly dressed told us to follow her she would take us to the hotel car. I honestly was apprehensive but we did and the car was waiting. The driver was not very gracious but the car was perfect. Once we arrived at the Intercontinental we were well recieved and the staff all greeted us by name. That is something that does not go unnoticed. Check-in went smoothly.We were taken to our room on the 17th floor which is the business level. The room was very warm, and they sent for someone to adjust the a.c he was not successful so we opened the window The bathtub was not very clean there was a film in the tub . We were offered the option of selecting another room for the following day. The concierge was notified earlier that it was my husband's birthday and we found a birthday card on the desk in our room. The concierge service was not that impressive it was erratic, when asked to reconfirm our flight schedule he did not want to do it,my husband basically talked him into it. The business center staff was so-so. When asked to extrend our stay they claimed the hotel was full .We had to go to guest services and we were able to extend our stay. That first evening we opted to eat in their restaurant on the top floor the food was good, no complaints about their service, and the view was exceptional. They surprised us with a birthday cake and they even sang Happy Birthday and other guests joined in. That makes for great memories. I thank them so much for this. Not only is it a good choice for dinner but for cocktails as well. The breakfast buffet is quite good, but the business level breakfast does not offer as many choices. Location is very convenient and the historical sites are just a reasonable taxi ride away the pedestrian shopping district is close by. The area offers many restaurants and shops and the subway stations is close by as well. Best of all the bed was very comfortable and we slept very well. Lots of bottled water was provided. The business lounge has a 6:00pm happy hour, which we chose not to miss. I enjoyed their local white wine. Besides a few gliches we enjoyed our stay very much. .

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: glukos
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms give a good first impression but it is not until you study it a bit more that you see the really high quality. The bed is very comfortable to sleep in. Just feel the linen and you can feel the really luxurious quality. I felt like i was rich when i slept in this linen. The curtains are beautiful. Go up to the top floor the restaurant is very beautiful. wow. food is also good. Try going to the bathroom of the bar and you will be amazed. what a bathroom it is! I also went to the gym expecting the usual hotel gym, wow was i impressed, this was the size of a normal gym!! Lots of equipment and space. The internet connection was also very quick Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “great location and service, perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Flyinghigh727
Reviews.Content: stayed here for business for 5 nights. great location. good internet and business center who gave me a power converter since I left mine at home. got upgraded to a suite so no complaints on the room at all. Real bonus was the club lounge access but the bigggest benefit wasnt the free breakfast or beers but the people who worked inside the club. welcomed me by my name the second day. they all were super attentive and friendly especially Idan (spelling?). They had at least 3-5 staff members in the club at all times which was mostly empty. I suggest buying club level if you stay at this hotel not only for the free food and booze but the great service. Only thing I think they can improve on is to communicate that they will open the gym if you request. I read from another poster that it was closed and was upset. Then read from a different one that all you have to do is ask. I asked at 5:30am and they promptly opened it for me. Overall great stay and if I return will book here again. This is probably the best Intercontinental I've stayed in and thats coming from a past was royal platinum ambassador.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbbasovFarid
Reviews.Content: It was unbelivible hotel in the heart of Istanbul! LIKE it!

Reviews.Title: “Unable to find anything bad to say.”
Reviews.Author: UkBobC
Reviews.Content: Writing this review from my room on the 17th floor with magnificent views. A perfectly placed hotel with easy access to just about everywhere in the city. Staff offer exceptional service without being over the top and they all seem genuinley pleased to be working here. The bars offer many choices and for stunning views alone just aim for the roof (Floor N), OK so you pay a premium for drinks up there but what do you expect? As for eating, I have a perfectly adequate breakfast in the Club Lounge and a few drinks in the evening all inclusive on my tariff. From the hotel you need walk less than 50mtrs to find more than enough choices of restaurants, so if the hotel seems a little pricey there are some excelent options. As for getting about, the metro is easy, cheap and on the doorstep, bus tours 100mtrs up the road in the main square and masses of shops (branded) and small bazzars again only a few meters away. I was apprehensive with reading all the stories of taxi drivers and hassle from shop vendors and can say that I had absolutely no problems,this appeared a very safe and comfortable city to walk around at all times and exeptionaly litter free. So, the Intercontinental, well it is a comfortable top rate hotel, I consider Intercontinental to be a statement for quality in standards and service and in my opinion you get what you pay for and in my case as the title says I can't find anything bad to say about my stay either in this hotel or the city.

Reviews.Title: “little to much used”
Reviews.Author: markus20er
Reviews.Content: the hotel is rated as 5 star hotel but in the rooms , especially in bath room it is to much used , i mean it is clean but it look like very much used , the tab is not working well ,all the fittings for the shower are loose,it look that nobody cares about , the room is modern and nice but the bed is not so good it makes to much noise when you move in it ,one thing is really special , it is the room service menue , all prices in there are in euro and not in turkish lira , so you must be care full what you choose!! also the mini bar prices are in euro! but when you check out you have to pay in turkish lira !! and the exchange rate is terrible !!! i know they dont care ! because the main customers are coming from the arabic area so they have a lot of money to spend , and the hotel will help them to do it , also in the reception the stuff is not friendly , you always feel that as person you are not welcome only your money is welcome

Reviews.Title: “close to Taksim square but to far from the old city”
Reviews.Author: Ineke_Belgium
Reviews.Content: When you enter the hotel you have to pass through a metal detector and then you enter in a large lobby which has a luxurious colonial/ottoman feeling to it. The rooms are a descent size, have a minibar and coffee making facilities. In the bathroom I even had a scale! From your room you also have a nice view at the city but the traffic noise you can still hear a bit (even though I was at the 7th floor). If you really want to enjoy the view you have to go to the top floor where there is a bar and restaurant. The breakfast buffet has a good variety of hot and cold dishes with also a variety of Turkish items. If you want you can sit and relax in comfortable sofas in the bar nex to the lobby and have a very expensive drink (8 euro for a soft drink). The meeting room are well equipped although you constantly hear the airco which is rather annoying and the chairs are not very comfortbale to sit on all day. Five star service: staff welcomes you when you enter; helpfull to carry your bags; when you return in the evening the curtains will be closed, bathrobe and slippers being placed on your bed and a card with the next day temperature will be available; when you order a coffee in the bar you will receive some cookies with it; restaurant personnel is very friendly and helpfull. Reasons for not being a five star service: front desk personnel could be more friendly (like the restaurant personnel); drinks in the bar (and also the minbar in the room) starts at 8 euros for only a soft drink which is too expensive; the food at the buffet is a bit to much Turkish influence; to much background airco noise in the meeting room. For having meetings the hotel is a very good value for money but if you come to Istanbul for sightseeing I would't stay here since it's to far from the old city where all the attractions are.

Reviews.Title: “A True Intercontinental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SH082
Reviews.Content: The hotel is all what you expect from the Intercontinental services, staff speak very good English which you dont find much in the city, helpful and very courteous, even though they missed my wake-up calls twice which was disappointing,the recepion was informed.The poperty is old, but still looks very much appealing, very fresh and super clean. Rooms are very spacious, furniture in the rooms is old style but still has its charm, colours can be better. View is excellent, even lower floors can still have the bosphorus view. The hotel has a very convenient location and walking distance to main streets and metro station. Lobby is very lively. Spa is considered over rated. Very rich breakfast, chef and staff were very helpful and courteous. Over all, i had a very good experience during my stay and it has added much during my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location friendly and welcoming service”
Reviews.Author: CJMarbella
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with professional and courteous service. Rooms are on the small side but clean and well maintained. Hotel offers a rather expensive airport transfer service, but to be honest its worth it due to the busy arrivals Ã¡rea, car is top class, clean and drivers very helpful. Sky bar restaurant on top floor of hotel is well worth a visit with spectacular views over the city, good service and well presented dishes. Wine list prices on the steep but that is standard for alcohol in Turkey so be warned! Then again that view is worth it from the top of the hotel... Enjoy it and savour it !

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good experiance”
Reviews.Author: salvatoreolmo
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in center of Ä°stanbul. Have stayed only for 2 night, and found all completely ok. Service was excellent, staff very professional, friendly and good english spoken.

Reviews.Title: “a much lower quality proposal to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bonstanislas
Reviews.Content: it used to be a perfect place to stay in Istanbul. They do care much more the money they spend: breakfast is poorer and the fitness closes before 23.00. So if you come back late from a dinner or a business meeting, forget about it. The carpet in the room is dirty and I hope they will update all the hotel as they did with the hall. Otherwise, you feel like in a shiny and gold environment from other times. Reception staff is not so nice and kind as the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Too Many Pricey Frills for Me”
Reviews.Author: Gwijie
Reviews.Content: This is Istanbulâ€™s version of a 5 Star hotel and all things considered, it was classy, centrally located, and of course, super expensive. I stayed for five nights for a conference. I prefer hotels like a Marriot Courtyard as the rooms are just as nice, but without the high price frills that come with a place like the Intercon. On arrival, even though I only had one bag, the doormen practically mugged me for my it. I prefer to carry my own bags, but lost this battle, meaning I was forced to tip the baggage handler who brought the bag to my room. I had to wait for this guy to arrive with my suitcase, and all in all I considered it a waste of my time. You receive a few minutes of free Wi-Fi a day, or can buy a contract for a better deal, though still pricey. Internet is censored. Each night, room service would come down to my room and turn down the bed, and put out a bathrobe and slippers (I usually donâ€™t use either). At night I like to either relax or get some work done, and found the evening interruptions to be distracting and even annoying. I asked the Front Desk to stop with this service, but it continued. The gym is good, but the spa is expensive. If you go to the top floor of the hotel there is a really nice lounge with a good view of the city, but a local beer costs $12.00 US. One great tip: In the hotel lobby there is a small bakery on the opposite side of the entrance. At about 6 PM, all the remaining sweets, breads, etc, are reduced by 50% in pricing. These deserts were awesome if you have a sweet tooth, and you could not beat the price. The food and service was good. Our conference provided breakfast and lunch, and both were suburb. I never ordered al a carte. You cannot, by the way, drink the tap water in the hotel, but they provide free bottled water. Most nights I went out for dinner. Stay away from really close restaurants as they will really rip you off with high prices. I found the wait staff at one nearby restaurant had padded the bill. The nearby shopping district has many restaurants catering to locals and side street outdoor restaurants for tourists, staffed by aggressive staff members trying to drag you into their restaurant; seek out places for locals and not the places geared towards separating tourists from their money. Iâ€™m somewhat old fashioned and like to send post cards to friends. Get your stamps in the hotel. I ended up paying a 200% mark up on stamps at a local ship, and when I realized Iâ€™d been had, I went back for a refund and received a long and emotional dissertation about how there were special prices for foreigners. I was only out about $10.00 US, but after living overseas for so many years, I still felt sheepish for letting the merchant/bandit slip this by me. While we were waiting in line to get tea from a cart vendor, I noticed the prices locals were paying. When I went to pay for my tea, the merchant tried to demand double. Istanbul is a very European city (traffic is a nightmare!) and it has lots of old world charm; just be wary of the tourist traps and what seemed to be a penchant for fleecing visitors. Give yourself pleanty of time to get to the airport when it's time to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Qindeel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is bit old and the rooms kind of reflect the same but the location is excellent. You can walk out and have breakfast in small restaurants just below and Istiklal street and Taksim is just around the corner (5 min walk). We were given an excellent room with the view of Bosphorus. It is not in the city centre but the travel to main tourist location is very easy with tram / train. The hotel staff is very knowledgeable, well trained and helpful. The service is excellent. The bar on the top floor has an amazing view (must visit). I would love to stay again in Intercon Istanbul and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Execllent staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: skottilil
Reviews.Content: During my recent stay at this hotel, I was thrilled by the level of hospitality of the staff. Knowing this was my first trip to Istanbul, he upgraded us to a suite with a great view of the city. The hotel for the most part is extremely clean and the staff is very cordial. The food at the hotel is great, although expensive. You are a short walk from major authentic restaurants so this would not be a great problem. The hotel is far from the airport and old city, which can be a problem. The pastry restaurant at the lobby is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Cryuff
Reviews.Content: Building is but old, but the staff is excellent and so is the service, especially the concierge. Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great country”
Reviews.Author: RedBug8
Reviews.Content: First, the country is just amazing and different, cultural, nature, historical and just great! The hotel is also very very good, its very comforting, service and in a very central place.

Reviews.Title: “Always Reliable”
Reviews.Author: Fulktheredone
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other hotels in Istanbul, and there are some grand ones in this vibrant city. For my needs, I like this property best for value, location to the walking area, and especially for the super friendly staff. Best of all is the view from the Sky Bar which is absolutely mesmerizing as you watch the sailboats, yachts and cargo ships pass through the blue waters of the Bosphorus. Recently, I was on a business trip and forgot to take a copy of my invoice. I emailed the hotel once back in London, and within one hour, I had received a PDF copy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul..”
Reviews.Author: nabz72
Reviews.Content: Going back to the same hotel after two months is an indication of how good this place is. The staff at the front door are polite and helpful, the reception staff are both check in and out are quick polite and efficient, what more do you need. The hotel itself is lovely.. lots of seating to relax around the lobby, a bar should you want to watch the football and a really good outdoor grill restaurant. Rooms are spacious and very well equipped with a safe, iron, tea\coffee making facilities, comfy sofa, deck to work on and plenty of complimentary bottles of water. And whilst the internet connection is not free at 25Euros for 3 days it is reasonably priced. On the down side the cost of items in the mini bar really are outrageous. 7 Euros for a bar of chocolate !! The patisserie had a great selection of items in the lobby, the outdoor grill restaurant is also excellent and if you want a view across the city then the rooftop restaurant is highly recommended. A word of warning about the roof top restaurant though.. for some reason the staff feel it necessary to hover around your table constantly which are the first five minutes gets a little annoying and once you've finished a course your empty place is whisked around within milliseconds. On a final note when I stay here in September I arrived in my room and had a selection of fruit left in the room this time around absolutely nothing at all.. Some consistency would be good or maybe I was just lucky last time. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel in fantastic area in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Smartilicious
Reviews.Content: Stayed here January 2010 and really liked this physically appealing hotel. Lots of amenities in the hotel including workout room and Turkish Bath. Rooms were clean and linens comfortable with a great view of the Bosphorous.staff were very friendly and helpful and always willing to help. Located very close to Taksim which has shopping,nightlife, dining and very cosmopolitan. Walk, taxi or take nearby train across to the Asian side of Istanbul to visit most of the attractions. Found Istanbul to be very tourist friendly and most places safe to walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: leo__691
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the hotel for one night. It was very nice. I will for sure stay there again in the future. The staff practically tripped over themselves to care for their guests. It was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WellWornPassport
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you would expect of an InterContinental. It is located within walking distance to Taksim Square, which is the heart of the modern part of the city, and there are many public transportation options which take you to Sultanhamet, where are the historical attractions are located. However, if you're short on time and want to hit the historic highlights, consider staying in Sultanhamet. The hotel itself is nice, but more attention is paid to its lobby and rooftop bar than the rooms, which were only mediocre. My only complaint is about the single, twin-sized bed. What luxury line does that any more? My room had a wonderful view of the river. And the complimentary bottled water, electric kettle, tea and coffee were a nice touch to the room. I agree with other reviewers about the internet policy -- this day and age, people expect wifi in their rooms, and for it to be included in the price of the room. Luckily, there's a business center that seemed to be open 24/7, and computer terminals were available free of charge. Also, the drycleaning charges were outrageously expensive. Though they did a thorough job, and returned my suit jacket quickly, the $19USD charge was a little tough to swallow. The lobby stores are outrageously expensive. You'll do better in the markets. There was one store tucked away in the back that never seemed to be open, even though its lights were on during business hours. I managed to finally flag someone down to find the store owner so that I could inquire about the prices. They were asking 75 euros for a pair of earrings with bits of semi-precious stones; I found the same quality and styles available in the Grand Baazar for a fraction of the price. On a positive note, the belt-busting breakfast buffet choices were incredibly generous, and you cannot possibly think of anything else to want! The sheer quantity of options were overwhelming. As was the case throughout the hotel, if you wanted any service, though, you had to flag someone down. All in all, the hotel was a solid business hotel, but the hospitality and little amenities were lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in middle of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Simon H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short two day business trip. Check-in was quick, polite and efficient and gave me a free small upgrade to the Business Club floor (without access to the lounge). Rooms were of a pretty reasonable standard (but no in-room movies), only real criticism would be of the slow internet service. Value wise, this is correctly priced as a low to mid level 5 star hotel in a central location. Have stayed in both the Cirigan Palace and Ritz- Carlton in Istanbul many times and found these to be appropriately more expensive but not as good value as the Intercontinental. So, if you want a decent room in a decent hotel in the heart of Istanbul at a reasonable price then this is a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: FotisAthens
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night on February. I can only rate it with 5 Stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel except for the good location and the good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Khaled_D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel when I was on a business trip. There is no way that you rank this hotel 5 stars. the carpet is old and smelly. The internet is extremely slow. The worst part is the housekeeping. Whenever I leave the room they go in even though the room was cleaned earlier. I was really suspicious. One of my colleagues left 350 TL in his jacket inside the room. When he came back he found 150 TL. Other colleagues were complaining about the housekeeping as well. The situation is really not comfortable. To be fair, the hotel serves very good breakfast and it is located in very nice spot of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, welcoming and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: allanacavaye
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in November. Very clean and beautiful hotel. Staff is very friendly and professional. Beautiful Rooms are very well decorated and have very nice furnitures.

Reviews.Title: “Grand or pretentious?”
Reviews.Author: AlanSL
Reviews.Content: Following a cruise of Greek islands we spent the final night of our holiday in a grand/pretentious hotel. Which word to use would be a very personal conclusion. Situated close to many other major hotels it is also near the Bosphorus and the busy Taskim Square. It would require taxi journeys to the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. Entering the hotel one is stunned by the apparent grandeur with a swirling staircase. Spacious lobby, marble and plush furniture extend into a "Palm Court" and a highly polished English Bar (didn't see anyone use it). Reception was always busy, usually three or four members of staff eager to respond to need. Checking in at 10 a.m. I was surprised and pleased to know the room was available immediately. A pleasant, reasonably spacious room with a good bathroom. As someone who suffers from vertigo I was a little stunned when I saw the floor to ceiling, wall wide window at the end of the room (8th floor). One must say it was a splendid view, but I had to hold on to something whenever I went close. We dined out. The hotel has at least two restaurants, but they are pricey. In fact such prices annoy me. We found a very modest restaurant within two hundred metres used by locals and tourist and had a reasonably priced and satisfying meal. At breakfast in the hotel the English are not forgotten - scrambled eggs and bacon are available - but Turkish fare dominated. I certainly enjoyed a mixture though the egg was cold. Service was good and the restaurant comfortable. It is not a hotel I would have personally chosen, but as part of the cruise package it was most acceptable, though a little grand/pretentious!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: WillemL
Reviews.Content: I have been here already a few times and the hotel never disappointed. This time, I was upgraded 2 levels to an executive suite. Spacious room with a separate working area, partially overlooking the Bosporus. Friendly and professional staff. Good breakfast choice, though the regular coffee is not great (better order espresso from the machine). Pity the city bar on the top floor was closed this time. The hotel is well located, close to Taskim Square Architecture of the building and the interior design is not particularly beautiful and is no way as sumptuous as Ciragan Palace or Four Seasons at the Bosporus, but at half the price a good alternative for business travel

Reviews.Title: “International standard hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: topturkey
Reviews.Content: Basically you get what you pay for: high standard of room, service and faciliites as you'd expect. We were staying on a free night voucher and had an upgrade to a bosphorous view king room which was well accomodated. Pool area and sauna facilities also good. If you want to visit all the old town sites and have limited time, then i wouldn't recommend staying here as it's too far out of town. If you've done the old town or want the newer area of town nearer the shopping, bars and restaurants then this is pretty well located. You're never going to get an authentic ottoman experience at a 16-floor international hotel but in return you get the service and safety element instead

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: It was the second time i stayed in this specific hotel and i even enjoyed it more! The service was great: You could have anything you wanted just with a phone call to the reception. The food was very good and the breakfast had a great variety. All the rooms were very big and very nice decorated. In my opinion the best was the gym... It was the biggest and nicest i have ever been in and the trainers were very helpful. The only negative was the bar in the lobby which was very noisy. There is also a bar-restaurant at the top flour with great view to the Bosporus and the rest of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: priti_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at intercon for 4 nights using our ambassador weeekend night certificate and ambassador points. But in no way we had any compromise in service. We were upgraded to a suite and given club access since we were celebrating our little girls 2nd birthday. The staff were very friendly and helpful at every level. The suite was just beautiful although dated but tasteful nonetheless! Ask for a higher floor because the views are just superb whether you choose sea view or city view. We did not eat in the hotel but the restaurants recommended by the concierge were amazing, namely 'kosebasi' near the hotel and 'matbah' near the hagiya Sofia museum. The breakfast in the club lounge was limited but good. I recommend speaking to the concierge before you set off for the day, they are very helpful. Cabs cost around 18-25 tl depending on the traffic and it can be quite frustrating if u get stuck in the mad traffic. So I recommend taking the excellent trams to the city. The funicular station at taksim is only abt 5mins walk and will take you down to kabatas which is the nearest tram station. From kabatas the tram goes straight into sultanahmet. Each train journey cost 2tl per person so to get from hotel to sultanahmet will cost 4th per person. Cheap and cheerful! All in all it was a fantastic stau and highly recommend it. We will def stay there if we visit again! Happy holidays. :)

Reviews.Title: “My Second Favourite Intercontinental!”
Reviews.Author: ebookpunkie
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very nice room service and excellent views of the Bosphorous. I always get offered a double upgrade and foego the suite for a view of the Bosphorous. It does make it difficult to work though....

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Stay”
Reviews.Author: ragtimeguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights and it made what could be a difficult city a lot easier to see! The front desk was very helpful and knowledgeable and everything was very fast. They were glad to tell me the best and safest ways to utilize taxis. For example, they recommended we visit a well known hotel taxi stand in order to get a taxi back from the Hagia Sofia to avoid any potential problems. This hotel is not exactly next to the that tourist area so it took a bit of effort to get over there. Nearby is a mostly pedestrian street lined with restaurants and interesting shops. It is a very modern and young section where many people are walking around. You just have to navigate your way through a park to get there. The rooms were very clean and modern. Everything was up to expectations! I would gladly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SanjBha
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hotel Ceylan for a conference but will most definitely stay here again! The rooms were clean and the staff incredibly friendly. The neighborhood is close to Taksim Square and the surrounding area is nice to walk around. The hotel had a very nice pool and spa/gym. Even got a Turkish scrub there which was awesome! We had a robust wireless and the breakfasts were outstanding. Yes, it is about a 40 Lyra cab ride from Attaturk but once there, you are in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: leigherin75
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ceylen hotel for 5 days in September. Very nice rooms, great breakfast. Next time in Ä°stanbul, i'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “OUR CHOICE IN ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: Maukyt
Reviews.Content: We stay in Intercont.Ceylan very offten on business trips and we call it our home faraway from home :) Rooms are very comfortable and the ones with Bosphorus views are the best, when you go to the bed you have one of the most beautiful view you can get in Istanbul. Breakfast is very good with live cooking station where you can ask for your eggs exactly as you like it and then they are delivered to your table. All staff is very pleasant and always helpful. It's always highlight of our stay when we see familiar smiling faces :) Thank you all in Intercontinental Ceylan

Reviews.Title: “Really well run 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ballycraigy
Reviews.Content: I have just organised a medical congress here and everyone loved the hotel. Service is exceptional and the food, especially the breakfast, is excellent. The rooms are very good and is well worth while paying the extra for the Bosphorus view. One can always tell a good hotel when the General Manager is always available and when he can be seen checking out breakfast. I have no hesitation in highly recommending this hotel in this fabulous city. But.........watch out for the taxi drivers! Only use those recommended by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dkfCT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located next to all major sights, but it is a short taxi ride away, about 15 mins depending on traffic. Staff, especially the concierge was wonderful. Rooms are large and clean and modern. The one caution note. They offer 30 mins free wifi each day. They don't tell you that is 30 mins consecutive mins. If you go off and on for total of 30 mins they try to charge you extra. We complained at check out and they did remove the billing. They may have changed the notice by now because they admitted their instructions were unclear. The breakfast was excellent, huge amount of selections and good food. I'd suggest dinner out at local restaurants since the local food is so good. If you want to be in walking distance of blue mosque, bazaar this is not the hotel to book. But if you want an excellent secure hotel, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “A good big hotel”
Reviews.Author: kamalysf
Reviews.Content: A good big hotel you don't go wrong with. In a big, popular old city i wanted to be on the safe side with the choice. it doesn't disappoint. again to be on the safe side I asked for their van to pick us up from the airport, the cost is very high, but the reason was to avoid the Istanbul taxi surprises which I experienced on my last trip. Now to the slightly negative experience, when we reached we didn't get the connecting rooms, the hotel was busy and then we were put on the smoking floor without being informed. finally the assistant general manager got involved ang got us acceptable rooms on the seventh floor.What I don't like is the shrug of the shoulders by the reception people with the regular dry reply " sorry". The taxis you get from the hotel are extraordinary.They are the same yellow cabs,but they have the hotel's name and the drivers are really good and honest. The conceirge arranged our ferry boat tickets to Bursa, and we were not sent to lousy restaurants because they had an arragement with the hotel.We went through such an experience when my brother was directed to a bad restaurant in a dangerous area.But he was staying at the Crowne plaza. The taxi driver took us to some of the best places in Istanbul for breakfast and sightseeing. Taksim aeea is very crowded, we didn't like the area.I would try to avoid next time.But I find many reviewers who like it.I believe the stretch from the Four seasons hotel to the Kempinsky and down is more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best Views of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rodolfo3200
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: Upon my arrival I checked in very fast, the whole staff was so very kind that I felt home even after a long flight. I was explained each detail of my bedroom where there were plenty of complimentary amenities and the view was incredible, clearly the InterCon Ceylan is located on top of Istanbul so I could see most of the Bosphorus and the charming bridge, the Haya Sofia mosque, the blue mosque against the horizon and so on, truly amazing. STAFF: The staff is simply fantastic, what I can say is easily summed up by one word: efficiency, everything was booked, printed out, known and informed so fast that anything was possible, also my compliments to the chief concierge for the service, then to Mr. Sharafâ€™s (I canâ€™t recall the precise spelling of the name) front desk staff which was very welcoming and Pinarâ€™s guest relations services were one of a kind. HOTEL/LOCATION: the hotel is very modern, fully renovated with beautiful interiors it offers amazing breakfasts and gorgeous views, the location is central, easily to reach any landmark, traffic isnâ€™t so bad in this are compared to the rest of Istanbul and the shops nearby can make anybodyâ€™s life easy when a pharmacy, phone operator shop or anything of such kind is required. OVERALL: my overall impression was amazing, Iâ€™m from Brazil and I was actually recommended trying the InterCon chain in my trip by Brazilian Guest Relations officer Ms. Agata Appel, who I had signed my Ambassador Loyalty Program with back in Brazil, to be honest it was 100% worthwhile and I do recommend staying at InterCon Istanbul as well as I recommend becoming an InterCon Ambassador.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, just prefer Sultanahmet area.”
Reviews.Author: 57TbirdLady
Reviews.Content: We booked the Intercontinental because I had a free night certificate, and am a Platinum Ambassador. On our previous visit, we stayed at The Four Seasons Sultanahmet. While MUCH pricier, I preferred the Four Seasons because of its close proximity to the tourist sites. There is nothing like walking out the door and being in the middle of the historic area! It was possible to walk to the waterfront from this hotel, just not an easy walk. While it was in a nice section of Taksim, next to a beautiful park and European streets with shopping and cafe, I just much preferred Sultanahmet. We arrived via private transport, booked with Backpacker's Travel. I am terrified of the Istanbul taxi drivers, with reason. 99% are crooks. This was a pre-Black Sea Cruise stay, and we only took a taxi once, from the hotel to the cruise terminal. I was relieved to find that the Intercontinental has a group of taxi's that are registered with them, and honest. This alone is worth staying there! We were upgraded to a Bosphorus view room on a high floor, and for some reason they threw in free breakfast, and free Club Floor access. Great except the Club Floor was closed for renovations, so the free goodies were located in the bar on the ground floor. The food array was very disappointing. There was a tray of carrot sticks, olives, and celery, and a chafing dish of dried out fried fish nuggets and cheese rolls! That's all! Breakfast did have a comprehensive array of dishes, nicely presented. The room was comfortable with a beautiful view of the Bosphorus. The electricity was unreliable, and their generator backup had to be used about 5 times during our stay. Lobby was very pretty, and no complaints about service. In summary, this was an upper level international hotel in the modern section of Istanbul. While I have no complaints about the hotel, and was treated to nice perks, I would have preferred staying in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “good but main resteraunt shut and not told”
Reviews.Author: simmo228
Reviews.Content: Hotel well located for all sites blue mosque etc, roman water aqua, palace jewels well worth a visit but get there early. As part of a cruise packege needed to be good Room very good clean, comp water etc, service good very helpfull staff. Only down side both main resteraunts shut in Aug ( should have been told before booking could have gone to Ritz ) so had to eat in bar grill or travell out, didnt want to do that, some dishes serously over priced for quality.and surroundings not so good. Apart from those issues nothing wronge with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location , excellent rooms and service but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed_Roushdy
Reviews.Content: I stayed many times in this hotel and every time I enjoyed my stay ØŒ being an Ambassador member I was receiving an upgrade and staying in higher floor with club excess , the view is amazing of bosphorous and old city, the location of the hotel as a walking distance to Takseem square is one of the best advantages , guest realtions team and their Manager Victoria were more than excellent and very helpful. the only drawback is the hotel price is high but you pay for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Booker30
Reviews.Content: I wanted some luxury in Istanbul and found it here. Great staff and a spacious and clean room with a stunning 14th floor view of the Bospourus. The spa is great, with a good gym area with free weights, machines, cardio and a pool area to catch some sun. I took a Turkish bath and I highly recommend it! I felt so squeaky clean afterwards! The location is good by Taksim square. The advance purchase rate plus my Ambassador benefits made this a good value.

Reviews.Title: “OLD, DIRTY, RUDE STAFF - DONT STAY HERE MUCH BETTER IN ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: dhaigh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Am an Intercontinental Gold Ambassador member. First they had two bookings for me and were insisting this wasnâ€™t a mistake, after my travelling colleague from work had the same issues they then realised this was a glitch on their internet website. This whole process took them 20 minutes and about 3 staff, all in Turkish whilst i am was kept standing at the check in. Then once that was sorted they couldnâ€™t find my Intercontinental Ambassador details, again another 15 minutes, until i suggested they call Intercontinental, once they did they found my number. SO after about 35 minutes standing at reception I finally to a so called upgrade room. The room was awful, old musty and clearly hadnâ€™t been cleaned, it had greasy hand marks over the windows and the bathroom was disgusting. I complained and said i wanted to move hotels, they then put me in a suite, which whilst it was larger was still same old furnish and tired deco. At this point the front office manager finally was called and then couldnâ€™t do enough, but by this time the damage was done. Only good thing about this hotel is the door staff, friendly and helpful. Donâ€™t stay here until they renovate and retrain staff, much better in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star Hotel that deserves every star!”
Reviews.Author: MaryLS
Reviews.Content: I spent 16 nights in this hotel while attending professional conferences. Not once did I tire of the breakfast buffet items. I also ate at the Garden Grille several times during my stay. The restaurant topside was closed for remodeling. I did have the opportunity to enjoy the view and drinks at the bar. First of all I must mention the staff. I think every one of them must go to a charm school before they are hired. The hostess at the breakfast buffet is professional, courteous, and friendly. Need I mention that she has a regal walk. I had a slight problem one of the first days, but the staff are problem solvers. The doormen who hail the taxis provide you with a slip of paper on which the license of the taxi is written on one side and the other a list of estimated fares for many of the more common attractions. The room was comfortable, the bed provided a great sleep, and I had a great view of the Bosphorus that was easy on the eyes. I never tired of it. The concierge was extremely helpful in arranging a couple of day trips: one to Efes and another to Princess Islands. As a woman traveling alone I was comforted by the fact the tour companies were ones which the hotel frequently did business. As a woman traveling alone I found this hotel extremely comfortable! On my birthday a floral arrangement appeared in my room. Also at dinner the staff of the Grille brought me a birthday cheesecake with sparklers and sang "happy birthday" to me. What a great memory. In recent years I have traveled a great deal and I would say this is the BEST hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “One of Istanbul's Best”
Reviews.Author: AG4E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located; itâ€™s away from the Taksim noise yet only a minuteâ€™s walk to the business heart of Istanbul. The reception was perfect and we got an early check-in at 10:00 and they even gave us a room on a high floor with partial Bosphorus view upon our request. The breakfast was also good. All this made us wish we had stayed longer as we only had booked one night with the hotel. The only downside was the standard rooms being a bit cramped and the beds which were not big enough for anyone taller than 6 feet!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view and Location - but expensive and avg. service”
Reviews.Author: tvr9
Reviews.Content: The rooms are neat ,clean and spacious with nice views. Importantly the hotel is close to Taksim Square and Istiklal Street (10 min walk) ..which is one of the most happening places in the city. Taxis are easily available..you need to bargain every time or they rip you off. Breakfast was good. The Bar on the top flr (Nth floor) offers a great view of the Bosphorus .The hotel is very expensive..so enjoy the view...but its best to eat/drink outside.

Reviews.Title: “great hamam, fitness, spa and breakfast....”
Reviews.Author: madflyer
Reviews.Content: Extremely satisfied with this hotel. While somewhat pricey, the service and experience was very well done. While maybe not the real hamam experience, this was a very well managed and staffed spa and relax area. I have even visited here after company put me in another hotel where I was not happy. Very nice facility. The top floor lounge had great views, atmosphere and great presentation with service of drinks. The breakfast was very well maintained with good signs identifying all the items. Varried daily the three nights stayed there. They had anything you wanted to order along with a huge varried buffet. The hotel had a very cosmopolitan atmosphere and the staff were excellent. While not really happy with the restaurant recomendation, the concierge station was always staffed with 2 excellent concierges. Very efficient check-in and check-out. Handled complicated departure well with partial to business, spliting charges and payment in two currencies. Obviously well-trained experienced international staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Silvi1
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Intercontinental because of the location near Taksim and because of the possibility to stay near Bosphorus. Hotel is in good condition, room nice and clean with nice view to the sea. Breakfast buffet with all you need, warm and cold but I think a little bit expensive. But nearby are nice coffee shops to have breakfast or the best idea is to go by taxi 5 minutes to the seaside and have breakfast in Hotel â€œthe houseâ€�. Very nice location directly at the water with all you need! Pool is very nice for relaxing after a day of walking and donÂ´t forget to have a drink in the roof bar. We ask at the reception for restaurant recommendations, we had nice dinners in Topaz and Borsa near convention center. Both restaurants were very good, expensive but not typical Turkish restaurants. 360 were also recommended but it was fully booked that days. At least we had really good meal at Hamdi restaurant near bazaar. Istanbul is a very nice town, clean and Turkish people were friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but watch your wallet”
Reviews.Author: mmbdo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for our stay by the cruise line. We were given written information prior to our arrival not to drink the water in Istanbul but to buy bottled water. My wife had a small bottle of water from the room refrigerator ( no price list given ) upon arrival. We were surpised upon check out that the cost for a small bottle of water was 16 Euros or $ 23.50 U.S. We will not be going back

Reviews.Title: “Tricks on customers?”
Reviews.Author: esart71
Reviews.Content: its remarkable that u will not reach your choice when you are on site sea view reservation : you will see the sea bu turning your neck from the windows 180degree to beleive that ur reservation is real they change my room 3 times after my refusingto change my payable reservtion as sea view a lot of customers down in this trick

Reviews.Title: “Great blend of business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Yamamus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here for a blend of conference and relaxation. We really enjoyed this hotel. I'm trying to think of anything that we did not like about the hotel. The bed was comfortable and the linens were in very nice condition, plus very comfortable, plush bathrobes and slippers provided. I can hardly recall hearing any other guests through the walls of the room. The staff was friendly and professional. In particular, even after just 2 days some of the front desk and restaurant staff remembered us by name. The staff are attentive, including turn-down service each evening and complimentary bottled water as much as is needed (you are discouraged from drinking tap water anywhere in Istanbul). We had the hotel's wireless internet, and it was reasonably fast--much better than at many hotels where it's painful to wait for pages to load! Our stay also included the breakfast buffet each day, and it was really a complete breakfast that included hot and cold foods of both Western and Asian style, plus a made-to-order omelet station. After the close of the conference, we were enjoying staying in the hotel so much that we extended our stay rather than find lodging cheaper or closer to the historic center. We were able to get a good rate by talking with the reservations desk, rather than paying the publicized rate. The location is convenient to Taksim Square and Istiklal Street. It isn't close to the historic city center, but the area seems more modern and vibrant, which certainly makes up for it. Next time I come to Istanbul I will definitely consider this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Great city and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cruff7117
Reviews.Content: Hire your own guide and driver. Avoid taxis. Spend at least two days shopping in Grand Baazar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller1900
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in middle of taksim. Most of the guests where arabs. If you dont mind its a mazing location. I loved the location in the middle of everything and for all things are solutions. really nice. Friendly stuff concierge super nice and comfy beds. Always again

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided if not travelling for business”
Reviews.Author: Kostiantyn
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay in the hotel making a trade-off on proximity to tourist sites and quitness of the business district, with reliance on Intercontinental brand (that was a mistake!) Overall, a shabby hotel with no character close to Taxim and business district. The rooms are outdated, as the common areas are, not worth its' price if you're paying by yourself. The bright point is spa and up-to-date fitness area with top-end treadmills with plenty of functions and Ipod socket. Not recommended for tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Large room with windows that open”
Reviews.Author: AussieNarelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business and was on the club floor. Everything was great, and the waiters remembered my breaskfast and evening wine preference each day. Room was good and large which was appreciated for a one week stay. And the windows opened - much prefer fresh air over air conditioning. Used the spa and that was great as well. Located at the end of the Taxim area and that was lovely as well. If I have a need to be in the business districts, then this is hte hotel I would choose to go to again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Service”
Reviews.Author: sallie_shaw
Reviews.Content: This is the largest hotel room I have ever seen in Europe that is not a suite. The bathroom is beautiful with a separate bath tub and shower.

Reviews.Title: “usual interconti standard”
Reviews.Author: Kyselak
Reviews.Content: knowing the Hilton and the Kempinski from previous trips to Istanbul I decided this time to stay at the Ceylan Intercontinental Hotel with my family for a four days city break. in April 2011. As most of the Intercontinental Hotels the building itself is a high rising concrete block . The hotel is centraly located on Taksim Square. The staff is very freindly and competent, assisting whereever they can. The doormen are very helpful when hiring taxis, always explaining the driver where you want to go to. We had nice rooms with Bosporus view. The lobby, the bar and the restaurants are missing some kind of cosiness but the service is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very swanky but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: luxlilly
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here, but expensive.. Massage was fantastic as was spa area.. Lobby is huge with a great patisserie ( psst -reduced prices just before they close every evening! ) Short stroll to town and shops..

Reviews.Title: “Good but way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: MichelAlbert
Reviews.Content: As Ambassador member i was lucky enough to be upgraded to a fabulous suite on the Club Level. Club lounge was ok but nothing to remember. Food average. The bed was very comfort. But like everywhere else in Istanbul take care with taxi drivers... TERRIBLE! The only thing they want is your money.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive in location. Disappointing in service!”
Reviews.Author: Deveshmistry
Reviews.Content: By far the most ridiculously priced hotel for the service they tend to offer. If you carry more thann1 device, you are required to pay for them if you require wifi connection on each. Likewise, no digital movie rental service. You need to physically check out their 100 DVD library service, stashed in their depressing "business centre" - half of which you cannot understand as the covers are all in Turkish, and to top that, they charge you to come over to your room and installva DVD player + for each DVD you decide to rent. Other than the location, this hotel is nothing but a grand waste of a show! The hyatt next door is far better & deserving!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a little worn”
Reviews.Author: Potty41
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just lacking something for me. The reception/lobby was nicely decorated but lacked atmosphere and there didnt seem many travellers a round. The rooms were a good size but were just a little worn. The bathroom was small and again the fittings were well used i.e. the towel ring kept falling off when you touched the towels, if you had a bath you had to keep your heel pressed on the tape or the water ran out. The towels were also thin and well used as were the robes. The duvet had the stragest lumps inside it and if you lay on top of the bed it was uncomfortable (almost as if there was socks left in from the wash!). That being said it was all extremely clean with helpful staff. There was a spectacular 18th floor and restaurant which again was empty but the food in the Sefton Resturant was the best we had in the 6 days of being in Istanbul well worth a visit - the taster menu was fab but expensive but worth it. The best thing about this hotel was the location, just at the top of the main shopping street which leads down to the Galata Tower, Galata Bridge and then you can walk to the Grand Bazaar. The outside pool was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service, very pricey room service”
Reviews.Author: TuncY
Reviews.Content: The most amazing thing about our stay was the quality of its service. The staff were extremely courteous and welcoming, doing their best to help. The hotel is located near Taksim, the heart of Istanbul. It's also very close to NiÅŸantaÅŸÄ±, a hip neighborhood. Rooms were comfortable and clean, with excellent sound insulation. Safran restaurant, City Lights bar and room service food were all excellent. However they were very expensive. Way too expensive even considering the quality. Besides this price issue, my only complaint is that there was no free wifi. This is a big issue for business travelers. Highly recommended (except for the lack of free wifi and the pricey food&drinks)

Reviews.Title: “Management Needs Re-Training”
Reviews.Author: Armando1986
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a "Luxury Weekend" rate at this nice property that included breakfast. Upon check-in, the front desk person was very kind and courteous and confirmed that breakfast and spa access were included in our rate. Upon check out, another employee informed us that Breakfast was not included. When we insisted that it was, he asked to see our room key older. According to him, the clerk at check in would have written breakfast included or not included on the key holder. Our key holder only stated the times for breakfast (implying that it was included) and did not say included or not included either way. The clerk insisted that we should pay anyway. When I resisted and asked to see a supervisor, an extremely unpleasant and aggressive gentleman by the name of Ugur Yurtseven, Assistant Front Office Manager appeared and he treated my wife & I like criminals, trying to steal something from his mother's house. He was confrontational and used arguments like "If you don't pay, I will make the employee who checked you in pay from his own pocket." When I pointed out that I am a Platinum Ambassador who spends over $10,000 yearly on InterContinental Hotels and that the precious key holder did not say that breakfast is NOT included an in fact had the times for breakfast listed on it. Mr. Yurtseven kept yelling at us: "It does not say that breakfast IS included." This unpleasant exchange continued for nearly 1/2 hour until the gentleman first proposed that "OK, I will take 1/2 of the charges off" as if we were in the Istanbul bazaar buying a carpet. I held my ground until he finally took off all of the contested charges but not before he glared and growled at us, making us feel that we were abusive individuals rather than appreciated customers. This lengthy and thoroughly unpleasant event at check-out ruined our otherwise pleasant stay at this nice hotel. Even assuming I was wrong and I liar (I am neither), the management's crude and aggressive methods do not conform to a 5-Star Hotel's guest relationship standards. It is a shame because otherwise, the hotel had excellent service and a superior breakfast, no matter who was to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very swanky--especially the common areas and hammam”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: Among the 12 hotels of our Middle East trip, this was the swankiest, although perhaps not my favorite (that privilege belonged to the Izmir Hilton). Both the common areas and the rooms are beautiful. My Platinum Ambassador status was rewarded with a Bosphorus view room--although since it was on the 4th floor, I would say just barely (but the view was fine). Some InterContinentals don't provide their Ambassadors with free internet and, indeed, this one threatened to charge me 30 Euros/d, so I only used it for one day. Fortunately, I was not charged on check-out, however. Although the price for the internet is rather outrageous, the service did work reliably and quickly. (No free internet in the lobby, either!). The hammam in particular is very nice--definitely the nicest I saw in Turkey. They have some separate times for men and women, but most of the time both may use it. The pool was closed at the end of April. The bar on the top floor has unbelievable views--and prices to boot. It really reminded me of the bar at the Hong Kong InterContinental on Salisbury Road at the tip of Kowloon: drinks with ruinous prices, but incredible vistas I will remember forever (unless I get Alzheimer's). My only quibble was with the concierges. One problem was that they recommended a restaurant I found horrible: Haci Abdullah. But when I looked it up after the fact here, it looks like it may have merely recently gone downhill. The other was that a concierge was socializing when customers were waiting. I empathize that it's often difficult to end a conversation when others are waiting, but this is a skill I feel a good concierge needs. That being said, I was quite pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “central location, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: MCEAAthens
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definetely value for money. It is very centrally located, walkind distance to everything in the city. As a priority club member, I was upgraded to a club room with no access to the club lounge however... The room was very traditionally decorated, as the hotel in total, probably close to the taste of the Russian and Arabic clientele. The room service was very expensive and the breakfast as well. I paid 125 euros for the room and I was requested to pay 40 euros for breakfast! The fitness centre was fully equipped. There was also a swimming pool, turkish bath and everything one would expect from a 5 star hotel. Service was very good in total. I would probably stay there again, although I would prefer a more European style hotel next time...

Reviews.Title: “typical 5 star hotel of a big city but a lot of impersonal hospitality”
Reviews.Author: alxanthopoulou
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fairly comfortable ae the Hotel offers typical amenities & services expected from a 5 star hotel. The room view was very nice, overlooking Bosporus!! The SRA & Turkish Hamam services were excellent but overpriced. The staff is friendly showing willingness, but as an overall estimation we found a lot of impersonal hospitality. The door-cards were dectivated every second time you used them (mine & my friend's as well) & you had to go down to the reception without making the mistake of not having your passport with you, in order to be able to enter your room. I had the unfortunate & unexpected need of sanitary napkins the 3rd afternoon of our stay at 5:00 in the afternoon. I called from my room the maids department & room service, I talked with 3 employees, but they could not understand what I was asking for. Finally I contacted the Conscierge, who informed me that there were no sanitary napkins in the Hotel.He also told that he was going to send a taxi to get a precious packet.. Actually after 15 mnutes, a hotel-boy delivered the packet to our room, asking me to pay 30 TL (turkish lira) the relevant of 15 euros!!! for the taxi!!! Seems that the taxi driver crossed half of the city!!! I find this incident very humlilating for women, showing that turkish menatlity cannot get rid of overpricing goods & services. Our stay was during Greek Orthodox Easter, as a lot of Greek people visit Istanbul theese days.Usually big hotels in every part of the world, show respect to such special events, offering special dishes, decorations etcThe most typical tradition of our Easter is to dye red egg in memory of Christ's Resurection.The Ceylan,which was full of Greeks at that time, served dyed blue, yellow & green eggs in breakfast.We asked for RED eggs stressing the fact that since they showed willingness to respect our tradition (not religion) they should do ti properly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my trip”
Reviews.Author: abidik
Reviews.Content: It is just in the center of city attractions and close to the great historical peninsula if Istanbul. The lobby is trendy and its rooms are comfortable. I certainly recommend it to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with caring employees”
Reviews.Author: BaselLawyer
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Interconti in Istanbul with my wife and our 14-month old daughter on an award. On arrival, we were upgraded to a seaview executive suite, which was a great surprise. The suite was very spacious and great for our daughter to run around in. All employees which we came in contact with were extremely nice and helpful, from the bellboy to the portier to check-in and restaurant staff. However, the Executive Club staff deserve a special mention. They were so nice and anticipated our every need, especially with respect to our daughter. They even gifted her a huge teddy bear ! The Safran restaurant is also very good. We tried some local wine which was very good (Signium). The view from Safran restaurant and the City Lights Bar is magnificent. Finally, try the Hamam with a Turkish rub, followed by a Sultan's Four Hands massage in their spa, which looks like it's brand-new. Only two negatives: the beverage selection at the Executive Club could be larger and the bed was a bit hard for my taste. Otherwise, a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: hsm1208
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel to stay at during my 6 nights in Istanbul. The location is great- it was easy to get most sightseeing places like where the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are, as well as the Asian part of the city and the Bosphorus.. not to mention Taksim Square is only a 2 min walk away! I found the hotel restaurants to be over priced and not that great, but at least there are lots of other food options near by! The room was kept very clean, which I really appreciated, but overall I wish the room was bigger (especially the bathroom). I have been traveling the middle east and eastern Europe for about a month and this was by far the smallest room I stayed in. I was also a little disappointed by all the extra costs that were thrown in... wireless internet was expensive and had to be purchased for each laptop in our room (this was frustrating to me as it was important for both me and my traveling partner to be able to work remotely on a regular basis), as well as other charges such as having to purchase adaptors (this was the only hotel we stayed at in over a month that required this)... Overall, although I felt service could have been a little better, the hotel is still luxury and is in a great location. I would probably try the Ritz Carlton across the St if I came back to Istanbul, though...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: CelaviCelavi
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights taking advantage of the weekend rate. It was my second visit to Istanbul. Note that the hotel is not located in the touristic area but where mist shops, restaurants and bars are: Taksim square. I got upgraded to the club floor with an amazing view on the Bosphore. The room is very nicely decorated, not old fshion at all. The hotel facilities are very good: pool, hammam, gym etc..The lobby is huge and well decorated. The breakfast was great: amazing selection of food including Turkish delights, fresh orange juice, omelette etc, etc.. Staff is very friendy and efficient. I had a great stay, I really recommend Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Luxury, Great Spa located well for old and new Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Fareham
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very helpful and located a short walk from Taksim Square. Fab spa, which is really relaxing after a long day visiting Istanbul's many historic sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ck1projects
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is good for business trips, not in a trendy part of Istanbul (not too far from it but not walking distance). The hotel does have an excellent gym (one of the best anywhere as far as space, equipment and pros, and then treadmills, etc.) and a great turkish steam room (time for men only, women only (recommended time for women to use without a bunch of men with/without towels) and then mixed). The restaurants on the top floor are very good and great ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sukanand
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a wonderful trip to Istanbul and it was topped off by the terrific service and hospitality and beauty of the Intercontinental hotel. A thumbs up to all the staff with a special mention to a Mr. Dogan. He upgraded us on checkin to a junior suite and offered us complimentary hot chocolate while waiting for the room. The room was incredible and made our stay very comfortable. It was so nice that we had to fight with ourselves to leave the room to sell the sights. Overall, Istanbul was a great place to visit - the only negative that has nothing to do the hotel was the taxi prices - they are so expensive especially if you are from Thailand like I am. Try to use the metro or tram whenever possible :) Also use turkeytravelplanner.com to plan your trip and use the backpackers tour company for the airport transfers :)

Reviews.Title: “Spa out of this world and picturesque rooms”
Reviews.Author: KB2905
Reviews.Content: The lobby and concierge of this hotel are both most impressive. When hailing a taxi they provide you with a card of what you should expect rates to be so that you aren't ripped off. The rooms themselves are a bit dated but this might be in line with the design of the hotel (80s glamour almost). The high tea is expensive but with a wide range to choose from well worth the money. The spa is what I truly enjoyed. The relaxation room has marble beds which are heated and overlook the bosphorous, an awesome experience. They also have a hamam in the spa which is useful to get a taste of Turkish culture (although not as authentic as the Cembelitas hamami)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-best location”
Reviews.Author: Marielaure6854
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for a three day leisure trip. It proved to be a great choice. It is well located close to Taxim square, but also away from all the fuss. The rooms are comfortable and kept well cleaned. A room with a bosporous view would be a good choise, allthough more expensive. Roof top bar also great with wonderful view of the city. Hotel staff is friendly and efficient and will provide any information needed for travelers.However they should pay more attention to breakfast wich is not up to five star hotel standards. Expensive internet use and lack of an indoor swimming pool are a disadvantage for the ones on business trips or those looking for realaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - so much improved”
Reviews.Author: CTCTraveller
Reviews.Content: I read somewhere that the Istanbul Intercon won their company award for the best hotel in the Group. After this stay I can believe it. I used to stay here but it was very bad - now its really top class and probably the best in Istanbul and I know - Ive stayed in most of the big chain hotels there. Its not cheap but then none of the big hotels in Istanbul are. The Club Floor is worth the extra for the facilities to hand that you would normally pay extra for - internet access, Club Lounge etc I stayed on the Club floor and the room was excellent - I have absolutely no adverse comments. Staff were friendly and the food beverage outlets were well managed, full of choice and clean/tidy. A real change from 10 years ago. My only complaint - two in fact. Do not use their limo service from the Airport - its Euro 177 for a 20 minute drive - get a taxi at Euro25 instead - that Euro 177 is extortion but seemingly people pay it or they wouldn't be charging it ! The other complaint - somebody decided to paint something one evening and the Air Conditioning spread the smell of gloss paint throughout the hotel - nasty but only temporary and it was not so bad in the room itself. A really top notch hotel and my choice for all my future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: andrewf11
Reviews.Content: Reasonably good experience. Hotel is located centrally with easy access to much of Istanbul. Some nice surprises (roses in bedroom), but service overall lacked a little friendliness, although it was efficient enough. Priority Club Platinum seemed to go basically unrecognized. Bar on top floor is definitely worth trying, although (unsurprisingly) expensive. Didn't try restaurants. Room was as expected for this class of hotel, but nothing exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: igor0611
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nearly perfect for a relaxing spa break. Both the room and the spa facilities meet the 5-star level. The hotel offers everything not to want to leave it in this winter weather. We had a corner deluxe room with side Bosphoros view, and it was very spacious. Floor-to-ceiling panoramic windows do their job and one can watch the vessels pass by during the day time and the Bosphoros bridge changing its illumination colors at dark. Amazing! The bed was very comfortable but for the picky ones there was an option to chose pillows to their liking from the list of about 8 different kinds. Other details were well thought out and taken care of as well. It your budget allows. definitely go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect in a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMohinta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ceylan for two nights and found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and conveniently located. The rooms were tidy and spacious - although standard and consistent 5* fare rather than the wow-factor. The City Lights bar is great as is the Safran restaurant. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “it is very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bishay
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel that my second time but this time i had a club room uprated to phosphor view twin bed smoking room are corner room than not real great view the room nice size but beds a bit small the lounge very nice but not fantastic varieties they are kind of tight but u have to ask for things to bring from the mean restaurant which sometimes takes time i really prefer the deluxe room with breakfast as service it was really great always smiling and to get a taxi really easy and safe

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: elpuri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in the end of October 2010. The hotel is lovely, the architecture is beautiful and I like the charming stairs in the lobby. The room was also very nice and spacious. The staffs were very nice, house keeping was fast and great. I was happy staying here. The location is in business district, so I had to take taxi or tramway to Sultan Ahmed historical area. It is also walking distant to Dolmabahce Palace and Istiklal Street. I found several Turkish original food, coffee and sweets in Istiklal Street, the street was awesome, especially at night. There, I also found a scraf shop that sells many kinds of Turkish scarves with very reasonable price (unlike in Grand Bazaar where we had to bargain for the exact same items). I almost could not help my self that I bought 16 scraves... :)

Reviews.Title: “very highly priced for the quality of stay”
Reviews.Author: cktiki
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Istanbul are very expensive, and even more so during the season period. We booked the Ceylan Intercontinental depending on the Intercontinental brand which for most part is quite consistently good. However, I must say that we were extremely disappointed with this property. The rooms were very average and and in the need for some major renovation and modernizing. For the price we paid (upwards of Euro 300 without breakfast) we would have expected much better.
