The hotel lobby was also ok and the restaurents also very highly priced. the fitness area was also quite bad to say the least - somthing i would have expected in a 2-3 star hotel. The location though is quite ok, about a 7-10 minute walk along the main road to Istiklal Cadessi. I think other hotels like the Ritz and Hilton in the are better options but my recommedation to tourists would be to stay around the Ortakay or Machka areas - the swissotel or the ciragan kempinkski if you dont mind paying a bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and great service”
Reviews.Author: GoAround7
Reviews.Content: If you don't want headaches in Istanbul, go to Ceylan. We've tried a number of Istanbul hotels during the years but whenever we want a stay without surprises, we return to Ceylan. The hotel is in Taksim and after a 5 min walk you find yourself in the shopping area of Istaklal. The hotel offers everything you need, but it is not an authentic piece of Istanbul. If you're looking for some old style Ottoman experience, perhaps you should stay in Sultanahmet. There are plenty of small family hotels in that historic area , charming and clean, close to the main tourist attractions, but you'll never get the standards that Ceylan offers although you are probably paying the same amount or more. And if you choose to stay in this area, you'll probably go to Sultanahmet to visit by Metro, tram or taxi. The Metro station is 3 min away. CAREFUL WITH TEH TAXIS!!! The taxis you take from the hotel are safe and the staff will make sure you have the nr of the taxi on a piece of paper in case of any problems. The taxis you pick on the street to get you back are another story. Many are rude, drive terribly and will take you on the longest route possible. We had some really bad experiences and found that it helps to write the taxi number yourself on a piece of paper and make it obvious to the driver that you did so. Feel free to call the hotel concierge and they'll tell you what the average fare is for the trip you took. They also report to the police any taxi number that you bring to their attention.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive Bosphorus view”
Reviews.Author: TheQueenslander
Reviews.Content: As Istanbul novices, we understood that Sultanahmet offered historic sites and touristy shopping and that the Taksim Sq area was more cosmopolitan and social, with restaurants, shops and bars. The Intercontinental is right next to Taksim Park, a short walk past it, the Square, then the famous Istiklal Avenue for a very "european" experience of Istanbul. This was the biggest upside and downside of this Bosphorus hotel. Easy access to bars and restaurants, great views, but an exhausting hike for tram users and mentioning the Intercontinental makes you an easy mark for Istanbul's less than trustworthy taxi drivers. Taksim Park is not recommended for tourists after dark and judging from the touting and being approached by random "friends" offering to take one to bars, Taksim Sq after dark made this hotel location uncomfortable for me. We booked a Club room and had an unobstructed view of the Bosphorus, with even a very distant view of the Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque. At AU$560 per night, it was one of the most expensive Club rooms I have stayed in, considering the room was pretty standard in size. The Club on the 16th floor had lobby-like seating with a separate meeting room and dining rooms (inaccessible outside of breakfast and "happy hour" times). Breakfast was sparse with adequate continental selection and 3 small bain-maries of warm food. Only Turkish wines were on offer and even those were low end on the scale of the widely varied standard of local wines available. The spa and gym facilities were great and the local hamami (bath house) was a beautifully sanitised version of the grungy experiences we had elsewhere The service was of a high standard, although the farcical "security" measures seemed quite pointless. I walked through the scanner with backpacks and set it off everyday, with no further requests to screen being made. Overall, a beautiful view, nicely appointed, great service. Of the standard you would expect from Intercontinental, highly suited to the less adventurous traveller who would be picked up and dropped off by drivers. One really pays for what you get; not much for free at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: anmalves52
Reviews.Content: I have been there from August 30th to Sept. 6th, initially for business and the last 4 days with my wife. The hotel was outstanding with perfect services. Chcek in, room, room service, meetings at venue services at the conference room in the top floor, restaurants, concierge: all top class and always perfect. The bar at the top floor does deserve a visit! I had the occasion to try in a week almost all services of the hotel: all top class. I had a room at 12th floor with magnificent view over the Bosfphorus.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay...great staff...expected more from Intercontinenetal”
Reviews.Author: ummhammad
Reviews.Content: during my visit to Istanbul in AUG 2010,I stayed at Intercontinental Ceylan.It's a typical 5* property with great Staff. I really was looking forward to a stay that really reflected the city's rich culture...this was not the case

Reviews.Title: “sub optimal stay”
Reviews.Author: ammar_jordan
Reviews.Content: The service in the Hotel is excellent, but i am really expecting more from an intercontinental hotel and for the price we paid (among the highest in the city). One disappointing event was when i asked guests service for an adapter for the laptop charger socket because my laptop comes electricity cord plug which is three pins and the outets in the hotel are 2 pins. They said that we had to buy it and one is available in the room. it is only 16 Euros they said! I am a frequent traveler and this is the first time that i need to buy an adapter. Another issue was the lack of English Newspaper in the lobby. It did not escape the management mind that certain people might like to read morning news, and Turkish newspapers are abundant, but not English one. I thought that it should also occur to them that normally foreigners mostly need to stay in hotels and as such, English newspapers could be an a viable option. The lobby is not impressive, and does not have any scenery, whereas neighboring hotel with same rating overlook the phosphorus. There is good quality breakfast, but food assortment is limited. We paid extra $$$ to have phosphorus view, what we got was partial view. you have to stick you head in the window at an angle to see.Finally the rooms are a bit small as is the bathroom. The SPA on the other hand is amazing. I tried the Ritz carlton hotel a couple of year back, it is within walking distance, it is cheaper and in my view a better choice especially the reception and rooms .

Reviews.Title: “As expected from the Intercontinental - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ozTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: A colleague recommended that we stay at the Intercontinental. It is a good location in Taksim. Most other people may stay in Sultanahmet because of the close proximity of the tourist things to do, but we decided to stay (and glad we did) in Taksim because it was near the shopping district and bars. This hotel is everything you would expect from an Intercontinental hotel. We had breakfast included in our price (150 euros plus tax per night). The staff were friendly and the concierge helpful. Internet was not complimentary. Swimming pool was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay at the Ceylan Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: FlyingEconomist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what one would expect for a 5 star hotel. The lobby is big and it feels like a classic, solid 5 star hotel, the moment you step in. Check-in was fast and efficient. The reception staff was very professional. The rooms are big and comfortable. The restaurants are wonderful. The food is very tasty. I recommend vividly the Saffron restaurant, located in the top floor of the hotel. The Turkish cuisine served is fabulous and the view is simply magnificent. I dinned there twice during my stay and both times I was not let down. The other restaurants are very good, but I think the staff needs a little more training, compared to that of the Saffron. The hotel has a very central location, and it is only a 5 minute walk to the Bosphorus. It is also very convenient if you want to explore the city. I enjoyed very much my stay at the Ceylan Intercontinental and I will definitely be back on my next trip to Istanbul. It is one of the best hotels in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel, but large and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: smbst99
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and has all of the amenities you would expect. Beautiful views of the bosphorus. Nice fitness center. We stayed in a smaller hotel in Sultanahmet the first half of our trip so I felt this was a little impersonal although quite nice. If you are only there a short time and want to tour a lot of sites, I would stay over in Sultanahmet rather than here. This hotel had more english speaking staff than anywhere else we stayed in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding status recognition”
Reviews.Author: archae01
Reviews.Content: The Ceylan Intercontinental is a serious five-star property, and definitely one of Europe's best Intercontinentals. Its location is quite excellent: Basically, Istanbul can be divided in three parts: the Asian part, which isn't of much interest to the traveller, the ex-Byzantium part, which is were all the touristical attractions are to be found, and the Northern district of Galata, where modern five-star accomodation, shopping streets, trendy restaurats etc. crowd. The Ceylan is within Galata which means that you need to use the dependable public transport (0.75 EUR, ca. 25 mins) to go to the historical centre, but which also means that you have a direct airport bus to your hotel, a breathtaking Bosphorus view (there are, of course, no highrises in the historical centre!) and the fancy restaurants for your evening meal nearby. As regards me, I couldn't think of a better location. The hotel itself is what you would expect from a steel-glass construction high-rise property; everything is as it should be (nice lobby with live music, efficient elevators, excellent security). What makes the Ceylan outstanding is the PC status recognition: In case you have the Royal Ambassador status, this is the place to be. We had free access to the excellent club lounge (which I would recommend anyone to book, not only for the food, but also for the relaxing check-in/out atmosphere) and got upgraded to a spectacular Executive Suite. There aren't many obvious downsides to this excellent hotel. I did not appreciate the way the window glass was coated which resulted in unnecessary reflexions (which is sad, given the breath-taking view across the Bosphorus and the almost daily fireworks), and while sound-proofing within the hotel was excellent (we never heard neighbours), a festival of the Communist party of Turkey who invited their Cuban comrades for a concert (no kidding!) was able to penetrate the sound protection. But the comrades stopped thankfully at 10 pm, and besides, we were already moved to another suite at a higher level. I especially cherished the consistent quality of the Guest Relations officers at the Club Lounge. I cannot vouchsafe for the check-in area in the Lobby, but the Club Lounge people did an outstanding job.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Nastia82
Reviews.Content: I would definately recommend this hotel. The staff was more than friendly, all the premises were clean and tidy. The breakfast was extemely good with big variety. The rooms very cozy and the amazing. Thank you all for the excellent hospitality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Western Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalEngineer
Reviews.Content: We actually wished we could have found a smaller Turkish Boutique hotel to give us a better cultural feel for Istanbul, but the ones we contacted were full for our time period. Then I found the Intercontinental Ceylan, which caters to business people but was having a weekend sale and opted for it. Being an Intercontinental, of course it was clean, nice, etc etc. We made use of the concierge who helped make forward reservations for a couple of day trip outside the city. This was above and beyond the call of duty and was greatly appreciated. The hotel's swimmig pool was nice, although we only used it once. We thought we might come back every day in the early afternoon to swim and refresh, but there was so much to see in the few days we had we just kept pushing onward. If it had been open later than 8pm, we might have used it more. Yes, we saw a Hollywood movie star in the lobby. I won't say which, but a pretty big one. He was just sitting and talking to the director about the next days filming. I mention this only because I had read that the Intercontinental is where celebrities stay when in Istanbul and I dismissed it as useless and irrevelent information, but now I can confirm that the useless and irrelevent information is true. The location is good, at Tacsim Square, and a fun, but long walk down the busy pedestrian shopping street and across the river to the main historic sights, but you can't do it more than a couple of times before you just start taking taxis. Fortunately taxis are easy because everyone knew the hotel so we didn't need to give directions. Turkey is an widely varied culture. It was fun for us to sit in the lobby and watch the local couples arrive dressed to the nines for dinner or various receptions. Very stylish. Great breakfast buffet. Lots of variety, nicely laid out. Nice service. Good way to start each day. My one complaint about the Intercontinental world-wide, not just in Istanbul, is that they nickel and dime you to death. Once inside, everything is overpriced. The minibar prices are crazy 5X the prices around the corner . The hotel suggested tours are double or triple normal. The restaurants are at least twice for similar outside. So we use it as incentive to get out and about, but boy if you come back to the hotel at night and are too tired to go out to eat it is going to cost you. $10 a day for internet--come on... I just don't get it because the ill-will they generate on the mini-bar and internet must surely out-do the extra $20 a day they get from you. If you are on business. This hotel is a slam-dunk because it is all so easy. If your are a tourist, then decide if you want a safety home to unwind in after your touring and bazaring, then this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: gorgw
Reviews.Content: A 5 star hotel with excellent nostalgic view. In my dreams I m always back to that beautiful hotel room with the enhancing Vosporos view... Note: Excellent breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Over the top fab!”
Reviews.Author: mauikeiki65
Reviews.Content: What can I say. Typical InterContinental luxurious elegance. Staff VERY helpful and pleasant. Stayed on the club floor so had sweeping views of the city. Speant time at the Turikish bath/spa. Only draw back is the location. The hotel is located on Taksim square far from attractions like Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, etc. If you don't mind taking a taxi back and forth then it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bwrCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights prior to embarking on our cruise. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. We arrived at the check-in desk about 10:45 on Easter Sunday directly from the airport and our overnight flight. Check in was quick and when we asked if they were still serving breakfast, the desk called up to the restaurant to let them know we would be coming up for breakfast to be certain they kept the buffet out for us. We were greeted cordially then in the restaurant and every morning thereafter. The concierge recommended wonderful restaurants and made reservations for us. The staff at the rooftop lounge was also very pleasant and eager to please. The food was excellent both at breakfast and in the lounge. All of the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We were so happy to be so centrally located. we took the tram to Sultanahmet and it was very convenient. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around.”
Reviews.Author: ArthurJMD
Reviews.Content: Its nice to enter a large well appointed lobby, check in at a well staffed desk with no wait, be conducted to a large well appointed room and get your luggage directly, have a good view, and not have to demand a better room. Istanbul can be a difficult place for non Turkish speakers, but we found the Concierge staff to be so helpful and kind, giving us detailed instructions that made getting around pretty easy, by underground and tram. This was necessary, as Taxi travel can be a disaster owing to the traffic in this town. One evening leaving for dinner at 7PM for a restaurant on the Bosporus, after 1 hour and 15 minutes, the non-English speaking taxi driver let us off at a different restaurant as he gave up trying to get to the original address. Unfortunately, his tolerance for "traffic" made him take "short cuts" which only got us into more traffic congestion. Had he stayed on the normal route we would have gotten where we we supposed to, albeit 15 minutes late. When we reported our adventure to the Concierge department, they were very upset and took it upon themselves to take us to the airport on checkout gratis with the hotel car (a new Mercedes). This is a delightful reasonably priced low 5 star property which we unhesitatingly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Rate, Location, Standard”
Reviews.Author: alibeth
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms on the spring promotion which included upgrades, discounts on food and services and breakfast. One room was upgraded to a suite as per the promotion. We requested connecting rooms, but the hotel was too busy and they had none available. Breakfast was good and included some local foods as well as international. My daughter tried the Turkish bath in the spa which is free to all guests and went during ladies only hours 12 -2 pm weekdays. She also had a body scrub and swedish massage which she really liked. We used room service every night for dinner and my daughter loved their lentil soup. They were always efficient and fast. After coming in from the cold the lobby was inviting and we drank hot chocolate and tea. The location was great, a short walk from Istiklal street with cafes and shops and beware the area is very busy> Location was not an issue for us because we had a private driver. Can't imagine staying anywhere else. The price for this hotel is great as compared with the other 5 star hotels at 1000 Eurose/room. We paid 245 Euros/room and really enjoyed out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: invivo95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Ceylan for 4 nights and I must admit that the location of the hotel is excellent. The hotel is located on Taksim square (5â€™min walking) which is the centre of everything: restaurants, bars, shops etc. Further it is close to the metro station (5â€™min walking), nostalgic tram (10â€™min walking) and Kabatas tram station (10-15â€™min walking) which is the tram youâ€™ll use the most in Istanbul. Trams run every 10-15â€™min and can take you to all important sites. I draw your attention to taxis. You should always keep an eye to the meter. We stayed in a Bosporus view roomâ€¦the view was amazingâ€¦.i really recommend it. The breakfast was very good and the staff very polite and helpful. You should try the Turkish bath experience in the hotel spaâ€¦.But have a look at the rates if you want any other treatment (massage, etc). I think that the rates are too high!!! I didnâ€™t have the opportunity to try the food and beverages at the hotel restaurantsâ€¦but I tried the room service and I have to say that the service was good, the food and rates ok but not anything particular.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: SAM-SYR
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Ceylan Intercontinental from the 4th of March up to the 8th of march 2010. We stayed at the club floor but we were given the smallest room on that floor which happens to be located at the end of the corridor. the room was too small. Service was very good and staff very helpful... specialy the concierge service is excellent! We found the Food and beverages too expensive, specialy the top floor bar/ We went to the spa for a half hour massage each and ended up paying something around 200usd for both of us.... Watch the rates... I find this hotel very good but nothing beats my favourite hotel in Istanbul... THE RITZ CARLTON.... simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant views, good location, efficient service”
Reviews.Author: Cooki
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental in Istanbul is a fairly modern high-rise located just behind Taksim Square. You get fantastic views from practically all rooms on the higher floors (we were on the 11th), either looking out to the Bosphorus bridge or the historic Sultanahmet peninsula. the hotel is very well run, with incredibly efficient staff who deliver fast and polite service. The lobby is spacious and elegant and, despite the fact that the hotel was at capacity when we visited, it never felt overly busy. If you are looking for a quiet and comfortable place to retreat to from the sensory explosion that is Istanbul, then the Intercontinental is certainly a good choice. The location is ideal for a visit to the city that wants to go beyond the typical tourist traps, and you are still close enough to the main sites: Dolmabahce palace is a 5 minute stroll down the road, the famous Istiklal pedestrian street begins almost at the back of the hotel, leading you down to the Galata tower (20 minutes steady walk), and then across to the Sultanahment peninsula on the other side of the Golden Horn. The posh Nisantasi neighborhood is again only 10-15 minutes walk away, with brilliant restaurants, the expected line-up of boutiques and cool galleries. I would also recommend catching a cab over to the Asian side and heading for Caddebostan, an upmarket residential area that is wonderful to walk around and has a bustling shopping streer (Bagdat street). The hotel itself ticks all the boxes, but does not deliver a truly outstanding experience. The rooms are comfortable, clean and roomy, but do not really stand out. I would have hoped for a better bathroom, as this felt rather cramped and a tad bit outdated. A separate roomy shower would have been nice. However, the views from the floor-to-ceiling windows make up for what the room lacks in wow factor. The hotel has one of the better spas/hammams in the city, although I personally felt the treatments were overprices with hour-long massages starting at about 150 Euros. The hotel has a rooftop Ottoman restaurant (Safran) where we spent New Year's Eve. The views from here are even more spectacular, but the food fell well short of expectations. However, even if not for dinner, it is worth going up to the rooftop bar for a drink in order to soak up the views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and we had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: carrollkvn
Reviews.Content: We felt welcomed the minute we arrived. Very friendly staff at all levels. We stayed on the club level which included breakfast and happy hour. Both had great food and drinks. Our room had a view of the Bosphorous. Room was clean and shower pressure was wonderful. Very quiet too which is one of my favorite things. We stayed five nights and never heard anyone else. The walk to the tram to get to the historic district was easy and the trams are very efficient. Bed was wonderful. Anytime we called down with any request it was solved in minutes. We accidently set the room safe incorrecty and called down an within minutes security arrived to fix it. Our only complaint was the laundry service was out of control expensive. $12 for a pair of socks! We asked about local self serve laundry and couldn't get a straight answer from the concierge. Also asked that the local tourist office and was told to go to the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “wise election !”
Reviews.Author: patanete
Reviews.Content: We have some problems deciding if it will be better to book a hotel in Sultanahmet or environs,close to the main tourist places,or in the european part of the city. We choose to stay at the Intercontinental,in Taksim,and we were delighted for our decision after our 1 week stay in Christmas and new year. The location is perfect,you can reach the historic districts by a very pleasant walk or by a combination of funicular and tramway,a funny and very istanbulian way to commute.And the Taksim area is more european and modern but at the same time is more turkish and less touristy.And you have myriads of restaurants,bars and shops around you.And the bus from the airport stops at the back of the hotel. About the hotel...is what you expect of a business five star hotel,big room and bathroom,all very clean and well maintained,good lights and almost no noise,good views if you have luck,the staff is always accomodating,the check in and out procedures were very easy and quick.We don't use any of the eating facilities,so I can't speak,but prices were not cheap in the Intercontinental. I absolute recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: abhineera
Reviews.Content: Very Good accomodation, Reasonable Breakfast, Average Food, Very expensive Bar

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Flyingagent
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very good sized. We stayed there for a week and ended up spending a good amount of time in the hotel room itself. The location is very good, walking distance (5 mins) from the central market place. Would return if I go back to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “sketch”
Reviews.Author: JillianL4
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel at the end of our cruise. Istanbul is a dirty city and we did not see the best parts of it due to our short stay. we were there for a day and a night and would be leaving the next day to fly back to america. everything was ridiculously over priced and my mom and i were just tryin to chill. because the hotel was not chill, we had a hard time chillin.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough for the price, insulting service”
Reviews.Author: TimRudd
Reviews.Content: There are lots of good things about this hotel. Many of the staff went out of their way to help us and this was appreciated. The hotel is a bit old and faded and its annoying there is no entrance in Taksim Square to the metro which is quicker than taxi! Some of the staff are really poor. I was attending a conference and breakfast was served in a separate room. I came for breakfast at 9.10am and asked the waiter to set a table for me. I asked 5 times for coffee. Eventually at 9.30am the waiter said that breakfast had finished and I could not have any coffee. You would not expect to be treated like this in a simple bed and breakfast let alone a 5* hotel where you are paying $300/night. What a rip off and what a lousy start to my day. Interestingly I was in Istanbul for a week and experienced nothing but help and kindness from Turkish people apart from staff at the Intercontinental. Prices for the minibar were extremely high - a small chocolate bar costing 5 euros. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect- except for the narrow, hard & lumpy beds.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustMBA
Reviews.Content: This is a cream of the crop, top notch hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Plain good ....”
Reviews.Author: Prokop62
Reviews.Content: Does what it says on the box ... very friendly staff, nice location, clean and efficient rooms, grear view on Bosporus ... - so yes go ahead an book you will not be dissapointed - Luxury Hotel it is not .. but then you won`t expect this from an intercont i guess ... - would i come again ... well maybe on business on leisure i would ssek a bit more "posh" .....

Reviews.Title: “Normally very good”
Reviews.Author: LongHaulEconomySucks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here six or seven times - I've often been left with a great impression and other times, I leave wishing I'd stayed in the Hyatt across the street. Some rooms are out of this world. It is worth paying for a room with Bosphorous view as it is breathtaking. However, while some rooms have a full view (magnificent), due to the strange design of the hotel others just have a small view (you might just see it if you angle yourself right). I have been upgraded to suites a couple of times and these rooms were amazing. The standard rooms, however, aren't anywhere near as luxurious. They look a bit dated too. The service is very very good. Checkin staff are always friendly. Room service is high quality (albeit expensive). The pool is really great in the summer and there is a sauna, steam room etc too. And of course a Turkish bath (which I am yet to try).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: omekdashi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ceylan Intercontinental for 4 nights with my husband. We were upgraded to the 18 th floor, the club level and the room 1824 was lovely with an excellent view on the Bosphorus. Great location , 2 minutes walking to Taksim square and Istiklal street where all the shops and restaurants are. The staff are friendly. The buffet breakfast is excellent with lots of varities and some Turkish specialities. There is also a Japanese section for breakfast. When you take a taxi from the hotel, it is obliged to use the meter countdown for the price otherwise it will be reported. I Just want to point out that the prices in the minibar are somehow pricey. I highly recommend a drink at the city lights bar at the 19 th floor with stunnign view. I really enjoyed my stay at the Ceylan... I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Kiwi
Reviews.Content: Went for a romantic weekend, and was impressed. Great views of the river, and good location for exploring. Pool and gym area decently sized.

Reviews.Title: “Ceylon Intercontinental Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hailfellow
Reviews.Content: This was exactly the sort of oasis of calm and luxury that one needs after a long. stimulating day exploring Istanbul....and it was affordable, with internet rates, albeit no cancellation refund. It's a gamble that paid off well in our case. The well appointed rooms, great beds and linen, huge floor to ceiling whole wall of window, the relaxing outdoor pool, the spa, the helpful staff. Just lovely. Well located and near public transport, enough eateries....The only downside was the expensive food costs if eating in any of the hotel restaurants.. So we ate all our meals out. This was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: NaniBehr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental as part of a large tour group visiting Istanbul. The location was within walking distance to Taksim square where there were many restaurants and shops. I highly recommend Haci Baba, a restaurant featuring traditional Ottoman cuisine. It was delicious and the staff was so welcoming! The hotel itself was beautiful with a gorgeous view of the Bosphorous from nearly every vantage point. The staff was very gracious and accommodating. I highly recommend the Ceylan InterContinental!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: ZAK12003
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an average hotel in most aspects. The room and bathroom were clean but had a worn out look. The lobby is the same. The room service food was below average as is their service. The whole hotel needs a makeover including the staff. The reception staff was friendlyish but the concierge was extremely unhelpful. I asked for a rental mobile phone and it never came even though I reminded them about it twice. I also asked if I could make a local phone call at the reception since my room was not ready and they sent me to the business center where I had to pay. It's the little things that matter. But I could tell the hotel must have been a nice one in its hay day. The location is very central right next to Taxim. There are plenty of taxis available outside the hotel. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, but maybe a bit too much..”
Reviews.Author: evaen
Reviews.Content: I'll admit that I'm not a regular customer at Intercontinental hotels, that might be the reason why I thought it was just a bit too snobby, too much "gold & glass", but it was very elegant. I stayed at a business room in the corner of the seventeenth floor and had an amazing view over Istanbul and the Bosphorus strate, my colleague had a view of the blue mosque. I had room service-dinner and enjoyed the view all night after a lovely stay in the pool. It's not too big but it's absolutely lovely when you've had a busy day in 35 degrees celcius:) The hotel is located on a hilltop so I would definatly recommend taking a taxi home, but it is still centrally located. I will also warmly recommend a cold beer in the bar on the 20th floor. The view is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “BEST”
Reviews.Author: Lulu2244
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was the last destination for us on our trip. We had seen many good and bad hotels on our journey so by the time we went to Istanbul we knew how European hotels are like and what to expect. In an old city like Istanbul it is hard to find a hotel that is not only clean but has a good location like Intercontinental. We highly enjoyed our stay here and would go back. It is walking distance to Taksim square and most importanly Istiklal street! For the money you pay this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Excellence, Perfection”
Reviews.Author: mehrdadnb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at InterContinental Istanbul with my family for a wonderful visit to Istanbul .Everything was flawless from the moment I booked this hotel.the Reservation manager answered every single question we had before arrival ( we had an infant with us so I had some concerns) plus some request such as early check-in etc.upon arrival we were received by a charming lady (Ms. Ceyla Korur) who is the Guest relation manager and she was an angle during the whole journey.The people at Ceylan were all kind and helpful the way she was. The hotel is perfectly located in the city.close to Taksim Square and beside bosphorus. some attractions are within walking distance from the hotel. we booked a business suite which was extremely well designed with an unforgettable view of both the city and Bosphorus Service was at it's best.the concierge helped us a lot in organizing tours and sightseeing . words can not describe the experience we had in this AMAZING hotel.you should have this experience by yourself and I highly recommend it to all.we are waitin to go back there. it was a journey of our life time thanx to people at Ceylan Intercontinental Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Paradise ;-)”
Reviews.Author: fbertrem
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a central location to discover the hidden treasures of Istanbul combined with a place to retreat and relax. We stayed for a week in the hotel and took full advantage of the wonderful breakfast and spa facilities before getting out in the wild. There are things that you have in your own hands with a holiday, some aspects lie with the people in the hotel and they were truly remarkable. Gentle and nice and we felt very much on holiday ;-)

Reviews.Title: “gr8 deals at best price”
Reviews.Author: karan87
Reviews.Content: the stay was very pleasant.. and the staff was very helpful and polite..

Reviews.Title: “A beauty!”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki1972
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. It helped that I was upgraded to a suite :) The location for tourist is maybe not the best, as for sure it is not walking distance to the "old town" with all the mosques and famous sights. But it is close to the main shopping street district and also very suitable for business purposes. The room is wonderful, large, clean, all facilities. Really, one could not wish anything more. The staff is friendly and helpful, just everything is perfect. Breakfast is good, lots of variations and some new things to discover for you. All in all, very recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with excelent location”
Reviews.Author: stefqatar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Taksim square which is the heart of lively Istanbul close to night live bars/clubs and shopping area. The rooms are nice although not very big and all amenities are provided (bathrobes, slippers.....). The fitness center is very well equiped and also has a nice hammam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience at the IC!”
Reviews.Author: PHV009
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 4 nights in september 2008 and here are our comments: Location: Near Taksim Square (the Modern City/business district). This square is animated and quite noisy at every hour of the day and surely at night. But the hotel is located on the quiet side of the square, so no worry with the traffic noise. Easy to reach with tram, funicular and bus butâ€¦ try to avoid the bus at the rush hours (unless you take advantage of it to make some sightseeing!). Just an idea: take bus 61B from Taksim to Beyazit (Bus terminus), then take a short walk to Sultanahmet and come back with tramway (from Sultanahmet till Kabatas terminus + funicular): this round trip offers you different views of the city! Facilities: Great lobby, big centre lights and stairs, everything shines, lots of old wood and gildings. Youâ€™re in Istanbul, the rest is just a question of tasteâ€¦ ;-) Room: 5th floor Deluxe Room with view on the Bosphorus. The kind of view that puts you in a good mood when you get out of bed! The bathroom could surely benefit from a facelift but nothing to really complain about. Catering: we didnâ€™t take our breakfast there but there are plenty of restaurants nearby on Taksim Square and in the Istiklal Caddesi (â€œIndependence Avenueâ€� = major shopping street). Reception: polite people, always ready to help you out Tip: have an overpriced drink at the City Lights bar: breathtaking view on the Bosphorus and partly on Taksim Square! So, a very good experience at the IC Ceylan Istanbul and we definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: SemaTyk
Reviews.Content: In center of Istanbul. Excellent but expensive! Lots of tasty cheap restaurants outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- outstanding staff, wonderful rooms and great view”
Reviews.Author: pitmannheim
Reviews.Content: great location for nightlife, close to old town, 2 min walk from Bus stop Airport bus Outstanding staff, all friendly and helpful. A visit in the bar and the spa is a must!

Reviews.Title: “perfect view, perfect location, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: travelalot2
Reviews.Content: very good hotel with very spacious rooms and if you opt for bosphorus view you get an additional experience with great view of the sea and even Sultanahmet from upper floors. Concierge service was provided by few members but the lady (sorry for not remembering the name) has been very helpfull and extremely charming person. Overall staff is very service minded and in most of cases servicing with a smile. Breakfast buffet wide and thanks god was in price. Otherwise it can get pricey comparing to the local prices. Location next to Taksim can not be better. Rest of places are within short, cheap and clean taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PeterKRej
Reviews.Content: Booked a room with Bosphorous view for the weekend. On arrival at 2pm the room was not ready after waiting 1/2 hour we were assigned a corner room with a tiny view of the Bosphorous. On complaining we were given a club room without club benefits and again no view. They finally gave us the room with a view that we had booked and were charging us handsomely for (234 euros room only). It took an hour to get this most of the time being ignored by the reception staff while they checked their computers. Unsurprisingly my feedback form did not elicit a response. Overpriced and not worth it, will stay at the Hilton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: drewantha
Reviews.Content: Elegant, Expensive but in good location near walking stree and waterfront. Food very good

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: puma11402
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after staying in magic life marmaris. After such a great expirience there this place just seemed good. There is great service and the food is very good but it is very expencive. The rooms are ok but have a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Fine But Not Special”
Reviews.Author: newyorkanya
Reviews.Content: We were put in this hotel for a conference and it was a couple of notches up from the Hilton where I stayed earlier in the week. It's closer to Taksim and the lobby is a bit fancier. There is a very nice bakery in the lobby and a delicious but expensive restaurant on the roof--Safran. It has a gorgeous view but a kebab dinner there was double the price of a meal at my fave kebab place (Tike) and the portions were smaller. As far as surly staff, there was one woman at reception who was fairly surly but everyone else was fantastic. I have spent quite a lot of time in Turkey and find the people there are very warm and helpful but, of course, it helps to get things off on the right foot by smiling and saying good morning before asking for help. I've stayed in an number of hotels in Istanbul and there are many with far more personality and elegance than the Intercontinental and Hilton. Some like the gorgeous Ciragan Palas (Kempinski) are also three times the price but some are not.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, VERY expensive drinks”
Reviews.Author: anothersuitcase
Reviews.Content: I stayed he for 4 nights over 2 stays late June/early July 2008. I have to say the hotel is superb, this would have been a 5 rating, but, as said in earlier reviews the price of drinks here is outragous. A few examples of this (approx 2YTL=Â£1): Glass of soda by the pool 10YTL, small beer in the city view bar 15YTL, local water from mini bar (0.5YTL outside of hotel) was 11YTL. One of the visits was breakfast included the other wasn't - again really expensive but if you take a left and 1st left at the lights there are plenty of eating places 200m away. Anyway enough about the add-ons, the service here is great and the views from the higher floors through the floor to ceiling windows are unbelievable. Good selection of English TV channels. There are many staff on hand look after all requirements. The pool area is well maintained and No. 1 son said the health centre ang gym were great too. The hotel is around a 5 min walk from the start of the public transport, you can be in the old town in about 20 mins by using the funicular at Taksim Square and then the tram, costs 2.8YTL and probably quicker than driving (chaotic!) Overall a great experience and would highly recommend to anyone, just watch the extras!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Shahnawaz-9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in march 2008 and ive found it an amazing experience,its located in the heart of istanbul (Taksim), attractions are on walking distance, helpful staff & excellent sevice. (Missing Istanbul)

Reviews.Title: “Let down by drinks prices”
Reviews.Author: lteast
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is good, excellent views if you are on the Bosphorus side, but Euros 100 more. Most prices are in Euros which is odd. I was in a Club room, and the breakfast was good, though the breakfast room was very small. 3 free computers, with printer was good. Staff very helpful. Position was fine, next to Taksim Park, good for taxis, walking to Metro, Istiklal Street etc. Main problem, referred to by others, is the ourageous prices for drinks, and food. In the hotel Turkish Restaurant, a small glass of Turkish wine, though good, was YTL38, bottles were over 200. These were the cheapest! Food was barely adequate and very expensive. When I ate at a well known restaurant in Istanbul, prices were half. There is a bar with a great view, but again, a gin and tonic was over YTL40, unless you had the local gin, which was not so good. Service was good throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Baltzan
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a nice room overlooking the Bosphorus, we pay for the Ambassador Platinum membership. It is in a busy location near Takim Square and several other high end hotels. The bartender in the top floor restaurant was the only polite helpful staff member we encountered. This bar has a great view. Each morning we had a continental breakfast in the lobby served by surly staff. The front desk personel were rude and most unhelpful, including the concierge The hotel is attractive and very security concious.

Reviews.Title: “Truly 5 star”
Reviews.Author: pbenj
Reviews.Content: Great location, all services truly 5 star. In saying that I did not use their dining rooms since I preffered to sample the many available city restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: ValAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Well located in Taksim area (first Metro stop is 5 minutes walking) nice swimming pool, well equipped health club, confortable room BUT terrible check in (could not get a key before 4PM!), the staff needs to improve their customer service skills (no smile, no hello), my luggage left for 2 hours outside on the pavement (?), when I asked to pick up some stuff from my suitcase (to be able to enjoy the swimming pool as I was still waiting for my key.....) the doorman took my suitcase to the lobby in a corner on the floor (where I opened it: some privacy please!?). For those reasons, this hotel does not meet the quality of a 5 star hotel. I would not go back, I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Europeaddict
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at the lukewarm reviews. My husband and I booked a deluxe room with a water view for two nights at the end of a cruise. The room was large, clean and very comfortable. The view during the day and night was absolutely spectacular! We were very happy with our choice to stay near Taksim Square vs staying in the more touristy areas like at the Four Seasons. Each night we walked over to the square and then into the streets with the locals and selected one of the restaurants on the side streets. The pedestrian only streets were full of people strolling, lots of activity and a trolley going down the middle. There were so many restaurants it was hard to choose. In the morning, we just walked back to the square and over to one of the red carts for a 25 cent roll that was something like a bagel. My husband grabbed coffee at a local place and that was our breakfast. We prefer to eat local fare when traveling, but also the price of breakfast at the hotel was exhorbitant. Telephone calls were also very expensive for local calls - we didn't even try long distance. We had a great stay and thought that this hotel was perfect. I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with Intercon”
Reviews.Author: PetenMary
Reviews.Content: If you want a comfortable, clean, all mod cons, hassle-free up-market hotel where everything works and the staff are unfailingly polite this is a good choice. We stayed here for 4 nights in March 2008 and had no complaints. Sure, things like the minibar are expensive (but who in their right minds uses a hotel minibar). Fresh orange juice, water etc can easily be obtained in nearby Taksim Square. Likewise, breakfast is very expensive but there are plenty of local coffee bars nearby. As for the comment that the Four Seasons and Ritz-Carlton give double the value, our experience when booking was that the Intercon had much better rates than any other 5 star hotel in Istanbul (the Four Seasons was nearly twice the price). The only downside is the location in the New City which meant that we spent a small fortune on taxis travelling across the Golden Horn to the Sultanamet area where all the standard tourist sites (Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar etc) are situated. We would be happy to stay at the Intercon next time.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptous 80s Kitch but with style”
Reviews.Author: Quality-men
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental in Istanbul is a "brass and glass" heaven situated in the centre of one of the worlds most facinating cities. The rooms overlook the famous " Bospherous" and our exceptionally large suite was imposing with its gold and marble lights and panelling. The standard of cleanliness was the outstanding and the bathroom huge with "9" taps and showers to choose from. The breakfast had the widest variety we ever witnessed including Asian, European, American and healthy options if you wanted. We would highly highly recomend this jewel in a sprawling metropolis of East meets West!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ny501
Reviews.Content: The Istanbul Intercontinental is in all aspects a fantastic hotel. Its location is perfect, its facilities top class and its staff way above average. I was rather surprised to see its average rating on here, but I think I know why that is. Intercontinental attracts a special group of customers, they mostly only stay at intercontinental and I think they may have lost their objectivity when judging hotels. I can imagine if you only stay at intercontinental hotels you loose your sense of realism. Intercontinental hotels offer this strange similarity in service and facilities wherever you are. I find it rather amazing how this hotel in Istanbul knows to reach its chain standards and I consider this hotel therefor way above the rest of the 5 star properties in Istanbul. My room on the 8th floor was avergae size but fantastic in facilities and ameneties. Fantastic beds, clean, quiet and great view. I was especially impressed by the healthclub. You can easily spend a full day here. The gym, is full size and its cardio equipment is plentiful and of fairly recent purchase date. Weigth equipment looked a little older but was in great shape. Free fruit is a great added service here. Since it was winter, the pool was closed, but it looked fabulous, I am sure you will enjoy this in summer. This hotel offers great rates through its website and I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all if you don't mind paying a bit”
Reviews.Author: Jetlagboy
Reviews.Content: We were on our way back from a Xmas trip to New York (Casablanca Hotel - excellent read my review) and needed a stopover for New Year and Amex suggested this as an option. The price quoted was $480.00 for two nights which I thought was very reasonable for a 5 star establishment at New Year. We arrived at noon and were informed that our room was ready. We asked to change it to a smoking room for which there was a 45 minute wait. We were still early so no problem there, the bellboy checked our bags and we had a coffee and beer in the beautiful foyer. An hour later we were given the keys to our room. The room was very nicely appointed with beautiful furnishings and great view of the city. However the bags in the room weren't ours and there were someone elses belongings all over the room - put quite simply, they gave us someone elses room keys. Fortunately for them the person was not in the room. They might have been surprised had we walked in on them in the shower. Returned to reception to explain this to the front desk and they could not understand why they had given us the keys to someone elses room - the reason they gave was that they had someone else of the same name in the hotel and that's where the mistake was made - fair enough - I'm just glad it wasn't my room, I could have been doing anything!. On arrival to our room our bags were already there and the room was just as gorgeous and well appointed and nice fresh smell - no hint of it being a smoking room as the ventilation and windows are excellent. After a sleep in the very comfortable beds and linens we went to City Lights Bar for a drink and the best views of the Bosphorus and the city - amazing. Enjoyed a bottle of wine for $80.00 Booked the restaurant next door for a really nice Turkish meal - note - exact same bottle of wine $190.00 on wine list. This was common for all drinks. If a drink cost $15 in the room service menu it would be $30 in the bar and $40 in the restaurant for exact same. Room service breakfast the next day was sumptuous although a 2 oz glass of juice and enough hot water for only 2 small cups of coffee is not good value for money on a $50.00 breakfast. I could understand a little less something else but juice and water, c'mon guys this is miserly for the buck especially if you are thirsty and getting charged $20 for a bottle of water from the minibar. The front doorman was very good, he greets you with a smile and looks after you. The room price was great, the other prices could and should be justified a bit more. I don't mind paying high for great value but for that you may have to look to another 5 star hotel to obtain it. However, the overall stay was good and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and Unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: mcsha
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ceylan Intercontinental Hotel in Istanbul area, and I must say they truly have no clue what it means to be a five star hotel. Although they have all the accomodations and the facade of a five star hotel, you get better attitude at a Motel. We had a group of over 35 people stay at the hotel, and at the end of the stay, we all agreed on 4 things: 1. Not one person smiled ONCE during our stay. Extremely unfriendly staff (with the exception of the bar tender. nice guy). 2. Transferring their problems to the customer. A few of our guests had issues with their credit card upon check-in. Instead of trying to help out the customers, they basically told them to figure it out on their own, while charging them 7 Euros / minute for the call. At the end the issue was with the way they are booking the transaction. This was explained to them, and yet they still repeated this issue with others in our team. 3. Nickle and Dime you to death Everything is an add-on. Internet access, 25 EUR / Day. Coffee $10, etc... 4. Ridiculous Prices I wish i had taken a menu for laughs. just some items I recall: - Beer: ~15 EUR - Coffee: ~5 EUR (12 YTL) - Mix Drink: ~30 YTL ($25 USD) At the end, the thing that bothered all of us the most, was the real unfriendly environment. This started from the Reception, Waiters, etc... On the positive side, the rooms are clean and the comforters very nice. Also, the hotel has beautifl view of the bosphores (not sure if this is the case for all rooms). As for location, this is debatable I guess. The hotel is located close to Taksim square. Which seems to be a transportaion hub. So getting to the more touristy areas (Sultan Ahmed)is not a problem at all. But it does require taking the Tram. In summary, for me, five stars is all about the service, not the facade. And this hotel has the cover of a five star hotel, with the attitude of a one star motel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: SpineyNorman
Reviews.Content: Made a mistake with my reservation and I was very impressed by how helpful the reception staff were in sorting it out for me. Iâ€™d booked at the Crowne Plaza by mistake and they cancelled that reservation (even though it was past the time) and gave us a beautiful room at a good rate even though the hotel was almost full. This is a classy if typical Intercontinental and very comfortable and elegant. Most of the rooms have fantastic views over the City and Bosphorus. The view from the rooftop bar is fantastic. It is an expensive hotel but you get what you pay for - the minibar is going to be a rip-off - don't book here if you are on a budget! I was really impressed by Istanbul - the City has come on leaps and bounds since I was last here some 30 years ago. The Ceylan is an intercontinental (small 'i') hotel and not very Turkish but enjoyed this as a contrast to the frenetic Turkish traffic and city life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - dont touch the minibar”
Reviews.Author: melba
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel no doubt, staff were well trained and helpful. I have one gripe and that is paying $15.50AUD for a 300ml bottle of Coke! I and the people I traveled with have stayed at many many hotels, none of us could come to terms with the prices for drinks, 2 glasses of water at $11.00AUD EACH, then another group paid $80AUD for 3 drinks and a bag of chips! Sorry guys, I don't mind you making a margin on incidentals but this is a bit steep!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent View! Excellenr Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ancinimancini
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a room on the 14th floor overlooking the Bosphorus and part of the city. Room was spacious, beautifuly decorated and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! I stayed with my girlfriend and I took her there in order to propose to her. During my check-in I had told this to the reception and they were nice enough to send me complimentary wine, fruits and a cake to my room. Had dinner at the rooftop restaurant. Pricey but well worth the money spent. It is a great hotel if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great View”
Reviews.Author: travelmylife68
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel last new year's eve and it was great !. excellent service, great rooms, great views of city/sea (depends on which room you can get). Employees are efficient and speak different languages and can be helpful for everything. Ask for a higher floor room to get the best view and don't forget to enjoy a dinner or cocktail at the City Lights Bar because the view is magnificent!!!!! DOn't touch instead the minibar stuff because prices are outrageous!!!!!!!!! In the nearby (exit the hotel , go left at first traffic light look on the opporite right side) there's a lunch/dinner place which is excellent and at very low prices. We enjoyed the hotel and is also located nearby Taksim Square which is the center of activity and shops , so it's very convenient to stay here in the new part of the city , more safe and enjoyable than the old part which is for daily visiting but not very nice in the evening, hope this helps you !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: scot59
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, friendly staff and very good service. Hotel also has a top floor bar with great views of the city. The hotel is in a good location close to Taksim Square and with restaurants nearby. The city is spread out and at first seemed difficult to get about, but once you get your bearings you can walk to most of teh sites. Taxis are pretty good, but the traffic at rush hour is very busy and it can be quicker to walk. The rooms at the hotel are of a good size and well furinished. The food is good, but generally it is cheper to eat out plus there are great restaurants offering good local cusine nearby. Overall a good hotel either for business or a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Superb swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Mosshot
Reviews.Content: Hotel well situated on the quiet side of town. Very good upstairs restaurant but also quite expensive food. Rooms perfectly OK. Big and clean. What you would expect for the price. The real star was the swimming pool- well designed enough for dips but also for a serious swim. Justified the long trip over to the historic quarter.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westonian
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights in an Executive (i.e. junior) Suite on the 12th floor while attending a conference in early September. Check-in was fast and efficient, and every aspect of the service to the rooms (room attendants and room service) and in the restaurants was uniformly friendly and efficient throughout my stay. The welcome fruit bowl was replenished daily, something that some much more expensive hotels in Europe fail to do. The room was possibly the largest junior suite I have seen anywhere in the world. The living area had a large sofa and an armchair arranged around a coffee table, a round dining table with four chairs, and a good size desk with convenient power outlets. There was also an electric kettle and the wherewithal to make tea and coffee. The bedroom area had a true kingsize bed and two sets of built-in closets; also an armchair and ottoman placed by one of the two enormous windows which provided a floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall view of the Bosphorus. The big bathroom had double sinks, a large bathtub and a separate shower. All the furnishings were very comfortable and in excellent condition. The dual zone air conditioning was silent and effective, and the room was quiet - I heard no traffic noise. The included breakfast buffet was extensive, and the waiter-provided coffee service was fast and friendly. Check-out was fast and accurate, no surprises.

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental Istanbul Ceylan
HotelInfo.Address: Asker Ocagi Cad 1, Istanbul 34435, Turkey
